loans.name: Derick

texts.en: Derick is a 20-year-old, hard working man, living in a rented house in Kamwenge, Uganda. For two years, he has been selling second hand shoes, and with the income generated, he has been able to support his parents. His major constraint is not having enough funds, and his business desire is to sell new shoes. Derick needs the loan facility to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand shoes

loans.name: Beatriz Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora  Beatriz del Carmen A. B. trabaja como Responsable de sección de Administración de Proyectos en una Empresa Aguadora, desde hace 6 años.

Es soltera, con 43 años de edad, tiene 1 persona a su cargo, la cual está en edad escolar. Ella vive en la ciudad de Managua en el barrio Monseñor Lezcano desde hace 43 años.

Este es el crédito número 1 en CEPRODEL, el cual piensa invertir en la mejora de su vivienda. Para poder darle a su familia una mejor condición de vida, a través de una casa digna.
texts.en:
Ms. Beatriz del Carmen A. Blandon has worked as the head of Project Management in a water company for 6 years. She is single, 43 years old and has one school-age dependent. She has lived in the city of Managua in the Monsenor Lezcano neighborhood for 43 years.

This is her first loan with CEPRODEL which she plans to invest in improving her house, in order to give her family a better life with a decent home.

loans.use: for home improvement

loans.name: C2883 Tujyinama Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 40 years old and is married with three children aged between 5 and 17. In this family, only Emmanuel works and so he has to work hard so that he provides everything necessary for his family.

Emmanuel is a businessman selling fruit and cakes and this business is fruitful for him. Emmanuel is the leader of this group which is called Tujyinama The group contains two women and one man. He is on the left side, most of them are in the business of selling foodstuffs. Emmanuel and his group has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses. Once their businesses are expanded, they hope to satisfy their customers and earn more profits.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sheep and pigs to fatten

loans.name: Alice Kemunto

texts.en:
Alice Kemunto is married to Nahashon Omenge. She has been operating a beauty salon for three years and earns a monthly income of ten thousand shillings.

Alice was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend. She has serviced her fourth loan well and will use the current loan to add cosmetics for her salon.

She will use the extra profit to open another salon. She has a dream of owning a big beauty parlor. She describes herself as a very hard-working lady.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics for the salon

loans.name: Aquilino

texts.es:
Aquilino tiene 48 años y nació en la comunidad de Yanahuara. Actualmente, Aquilino vive en la ciudad de donde nació, él es casado y fruto de esta unión tienen cuatro hijos, él es una padre luchador, trabajador  que a pesar de las adversidad saca adelante a su familia, él trabaja en una empresa privada de obrero y ya son cuatro meses que trabaja  y le va muy bien, él en esta oportunidad requiere el micro crédito para uso personal lo que desea es hacer mantenimiento de su casa. 

Aquilino pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Marcela de Virgen del Carmen” de la Asociación Arariwa  y trabaja con sus compañeras del banco comunal desde hace varias años.
texts.en:
Aquilino is 48 years old and was born in Yanahuara community.  He currently lives in the community in which he was born.  Aquilino is married and has four children.  He is a driven, hard-working father who, in spite of the adversity he faces, manages to get his family ahead in life.  Aquilino works for a private company as a manual worker.  He has been in his job for four months and it is going very well.  On this occasion, he requires a loan for personal use as he would like to do some maintenance work on his home. 

Aquilino is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “Villa Marcela de Virgen del Carmen” community bank and has been working with his fellow bank members for several years.

loans.use: to do some maintenance work on his home (personal use)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy all the goods he needs in his general store.

loans.name: Geronica

texts.en:
Geronica is from the village of Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Geronica runs a business venture in the food sector selling fish. Her main source of income comes from selling fish in the local community.

Geronica has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns approximately 2900 PHP a month for these activities. Geronica joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase more fish to sell.

Geronica is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP with which will serve as financing in repairing her fishing boat for her fishing activity. This will be the 12th loan taken out by her from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat for fishing activity

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita, who works hard to support one child, is married and has a general store in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit Cookstove in order to lessen the amount of firewood she uses when cooking for her family. The cookstove will not only help her to save money but also help the environment and reduce health risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase an Envirofit Cookstove.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha, de 47 años, convive desde hace 27 años con Jorge. Ambos forman una hermosa familia con 4 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Alto Yapaz (selva central peruana). La sonrisa que la caracteriza es producto de su actitud en el trabajo. Desde hace 20 años que se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando café y piña en sus terrenos agrícolas que se ubican en la zona alta de San Francisco, donde trascurre la mayor parte del día, según cuenta existen días donde se queda a descansar en un choza que acondicionó entre sus plantaciones. “Me gusta mantener limpio mis cultivos”, afirma. Cuenta además que en este año el precio del café es muy bueno. Por lo que augura obtendrá buenas ganancias. Su principal dificultad es la falta de capital de trabajo pues se dedica a la siembra paralela de piña, donde invierte mayor cantidad de dinero, y además de requerir mayores cuidados. Por ello más adelante está pensando comprar un camión con el que pueda trasladar su producción y vender por su propia cuenta sin intermediarios, logrando así tener mayor rentabilidad. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los progresistas”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece la oportunidad de éxito que le brindan. Bertha, invertirá el crédito en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico los cuales esparcirá en sus cultivos de café, ya que necesita nivelar su producción en esta temporada de extracción del primer grano de café.
texts.en:
Bertha is 47 years old and has lived with Jorge for 27 years.  Together they have a beautiful family with four children, but they only live with two of them in their own house located in the town of Alto Yapaz (central Peruvian jungle).  The smile that she is known for is a product of her attitude to work.  

For 20 years, she has been a farmer, planting coffee and pineapple in her agricultural lands located in the high area of San Fransisco.  She spends most of her day there, and says there are days when she stays there to rest in a hut she set up between her plantations.  She says, "I like to keep my crops clean."  She says that this year the price of coffee is very good, so she predicts she will earn a good income.  Her main difficulty is the lack of working capital, so she also plants pineapple, where she invests a larger quantity of money, and it also requires more care.  In the future, she is thinking of purchasing a truck to transport their crops and sell them themselves without intermediaries so they can earn more money.  

She is a member of the community bank Los Progresistas, and this is her first loan with MFP.  She is thankful for the opportunity for success that was given to her.  Bertha will use this loan to purchase sacks of organic fertilizer for her coffee crops, since she needs to balance her production during the season's first coffee bean extraction.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Eduardo Antonio

texts.es:
Eduardo, está casado, tiene dos hijos, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y también tiene un taller de mecánica, estas ocupaciones son las que le dan a Eduardo los ingresos para cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
El está en proceso de iniciar el cultivo de maíz, por lo que solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y tratamiento para suelos, con estos materiales preparara el terreno y cultivara la milpa.
Su objetivo es tener ocupaciones que le generen ganancias para cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
Eduardo is married and has two children.  He grows corn, and he also has a mechanic’s shop.  These are the businesses that give Eduardo the income to cover the household necessities.

He is in the process of starting to plant corn.  That is why he is requesting a loan.  The loan is to buy fertilizer and soil treatments.  He will use these materials to prepare the land, and he will cultivate the cornfield.

His objective is to have businesses that generate earnings to cover the household necessities.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and soil treatments.

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
This is Rosemarie, 44, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Henry, an auto welder, and mother to their children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosemarie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Rosemarie earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 280 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rosemarie hopes to be able to expand soon and succeed in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery products and inventory items needed in her variety store.

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.en:
Jumagul is married with 4 children. She has been running a grocery business for 18 years. Jumagul is a very open, enthusiastic and responsible person. She has already borrowed from IMON International and paid back her loan on time. She says that the loan helped her to generate additional income. Jumagul takes care of her elderly parents and helps them with what they need. Jumagul would like to obtain a loan of $1,200 USD to increase her inventory. She hopes to sell more and generate additional income.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase foodstuff for her business

loans.name: Nuestra Señora De Guadalupe Group

texts.es: El Banco de comunal Nuestra Señora De Guadalupe está conformado por 9 Integrantes todas son Mujeres y las señoras se dedican al comercio y venta de pescado y otros, y Señora Gloria es la presidenta del Banco tiene dos hijos y ella se dedica a una pulpería, actividad donde le va muy bien y con el préstamo comprara granos básicos, jugos, refrescos, papel higiénico, fósforos sal y pan. Es una persona muy trabajadora y siempre pensando en el bienestar de sus hijos, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The Our Lady of Guadalupe Communal Bank consists of 9 members, all of whom are women. They dedicate themselves to their businesses, selling fish among other things. Señora Gloria is the president of the bank. She has 2 children and runs a grocery store, which is going well. With the loan she plans to buy grain, juices, sodas, toilet paper, matches, salt and bread. She is a very hard-working person, always thinking of her children's well-being. She is grateful to the organisation for the support offered.

loans.use: To buy grain, juices, sodas, toilet paper, matches, salt and bread.

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en: Jelly is married with 4 children. She is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. Jelly is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle. Jelly has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
 
Erlinda has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Erlinda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Samit

texts.en: 52 year old Samit is a housewife. Her husband is a construction worker with an income of $10 per day. She has three children, all of whom work in the factory for $3 per day each. Every month, she has to spend $60 on food, $9 on electricity, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy eggs for resale. This loan will help her to build a career that can generate income to support the family. In the future, she hopes to have enough money to rebuild her house and make it better than it currently is.

loans.use: To buy eggs for resale

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia has practiced farming for the last six years.  She is 54 years old, married to Peter and they have three school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Sophia hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: Divina is 31 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.  For the past 5 years she has been running a sari-sari store in the Philippines, where sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles and other groceries.  She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.  In the future Divina would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: Maria Dolores cuenta con su negocio de venta de ropa usada desde hace 4 años ofreciendo buena calidad y servicio a sus clientes. Para María este negocio es muy importante para ella por que de esta manera apoya a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. El negocio queda ubicado en una de las colonias de la ciudad donde se ponen muchos comerciantes de todo tipo de artículos pero que ella se diferencia con el trato y calidad que ofrece. María Dolores quiere comprar un toldo, por que en temporadas de lluvia o cuando esta soleado sufre las inclemencias del tiempo, y no quiere llegar a contagiarse de una enfermedad a causa de esto. Aparte de proteger ella misma también le conservara su mercancía en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Maria Dolores has a business selling used clothing. For the past four years, she has been offering good quality and service to her customers. For Maria, this business is very important to her because it allows her to help her husband with the household expenses. Her business is located in one of the subdivisions of the city where there are many merchants who sell all types of products. However, Maria differentiates herself by the service and quality she offers.

Maria Dolores wants to buy a canopy for the rainy season and to use for protection on sunny days. She does not want to risk getting sick because of the weather. In addition, she will be able to protect her merchandise so that it remains in excellent condition.

loans.use: to buy a canopy for her business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 61 and widowed. She has four adult children and they live happily in a village. Despite being a widow, she has strong faith and determination to improve their status of living and become successful in the future. 

To generate income, she engages in hog-raising and selling soft drinks in their village. She has been in this business for more than 10 years now and usually earns a profit of PHP 9,000 a month, which she uses for their basic necessities.

She aims to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers needs, but due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 22,000 to buy soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, beverages and snack food to sell in her variety store. 

She mentioned that this loan will help a lot to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, beverages and snack foods to sell in her variety store.

location.town: Brgy. La Torre North, Bayombong,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is a 48-year-old man.  He is married and has seven sons and three daughters.  He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary.   He is also a taxi driver. 

Sami wants to make some necessary repairs to the taxi he owns and drives to increase its efficiency and ability to work, but the amount of money he has isn't enough, so he needs to take a loan amount of $2,000 from FATEN. 

When Sami gets the loan, he will be able to pay for the taxi repairing expenses.  This will increase the taxi's efficiency and Sami will have the ability to work extra hours and increase his income so that he can provide to his family better life conditions. 

Sami is photographed next to the taxi he owns.

loans.use: repair his taxi

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 26 years old and single. He sells cakes and has been in business for the past five years. He monthly income is about KES 4,000.

This is his first loan with KADET LTD.  He will use the loan amount to purchase more cakes to resell.

Anticipated profit will be put back into his business. Patrick's dream is to venture into real estate.

loans.use: to buy more cakes to resell.

loans.name: Jemimmah

texts.en: Jemimmah is a married woman aged 38. For the last two years she has been running a grocery business where she sell fruits, vegetable and tomatoes to make a living. Even though she runs her business in a very competitive environment, she is able to retain her business because of her good reputation. She has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to open another outlet for her business. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business into wholesale.

loans.use: To open another outlet for her business.

loans.name: Lilia Amparo

texts.es: La señora Lilia a sus 51 años D. edad es madre D. diez hijos, a los cuales sin la ayuda D. su padre a sacado adelante y les ha brindado educación, alimentación y un hogar, lo anterior ha sido con mucho esfuerzo y gracias a que ha trabajado fuertemente en ventas D. comida en la calle, en tiendas y cafeterías; hace dos años inicio su propio negocio con una legumbreria. Hoy día, la señora Lilia tiene una tienda D. legumbres y granos con la cual pueD. apoyar a sus tres hijos menores D. edad. Actualmente, la señora Lilia desea comprar surtido como productos lácteos y una estantería para ubicar y presentar mejor la verdura. El sueño D. la señora Lilia es dejarle la tienda a su hija D. 18 años y ella poder montar su propia cafetería.
texts.en: Lilia, 51, is the mother of 10 children, whom she has supported without the help of their father.  She has provided them with food, an education, and a home, the latter of which she managed with a great deal of effort, working hard selling food in the street, in stores, and in cafes.  Two years ago she started her own business with a produce shop.  Now Lilia has a vegetable and grain store where she works to support her 3 minor children.  At this time, Lillia wants to buy more products, such as dairy products, and shelving that can hold and better display her vegetables.  Lilia's dream is to leave the store to her 18 year-old daughter and start her own cafe.

loans.use: to stock her store with dairy products, and to buy shelving to better hold and display her produce

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Despite the competitive nature of his the industry of business, a butcher shop, 32 year old Sam has exhibited a strong sense of determination, poise and innovation.
These have been the bedrock of the gradual strides he has been making the last two years. It was at the threshold of 2009 that he set forth this business.
On the side, he is also inclined to farming.
His weekly profits average between UGX 30,000-45,000.
The jolly, resolute and tenacious father of two says this loan will come in handy in the purchase of more cattle. He also intends to expand his butcher shop.

loans.use: to purchase of more cattle. He also intends to expand his butcher shop.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is a 51-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has been in the fishing business for 15 years. Francisca and her husband work together to improve their business and sustain their family. Francisca requested a loan to repair her fishing boat and buy fishing nets. This will help her to continue earning from their business. She hopes to have a stable income and for her children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat and buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: Josefina, de 47 años es una mujer singular. Vive en compañía de su esposo Daniel, con quien tiene 25 años de casados. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo 3 viven con ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Atocc.  Hace 26 años, conformó su familia. Desde entonces tuvo que afrontar muchas adversidades, entre ella comprar su propia casa. Por ello comenzó a sembrar en terrenos propios papa, olluco y habas. Cuenta que en cada cosecha, obtiene buenos ingresos; pues los comercializa en la capital del país, Pampas o Huancayo; todo depende del precio que le ofrece manifiesta Josefina. Asimismo tiene vacas, ovejas y demás ganados que le proporciona leche; con la que se alimenta y vende depende de la cantidad de litros que saca de su ganado. Ahora desea aumentar sus animales y mejorar sus cultivos para tener buenas ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal, sol naciente, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada; pues sus miembros son personas solidarias y muy trabajadoras. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Josefina, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Josefina is 47, and an exceptional woman. She lives with her husband Daniel, and they have been married for 25 years. They have five children, but only three live with them in their own house, located in the village of Atocc. 

She started her family 26 years ago, and since then, has had to face a lot of challenges, including buying her own house. That's why she began to grow potatoes, olluco (a root vegetable), and lima beans on her own land. 

She says that she gets a good return at every harvest, as she sells her crops in the country's capital, Lima, in Pampas or in Huancayo. It all depends on the price she is offered, says Josefina.  As well, she has cows, sheep and other livestock that provide her with milk, which she uses to feed herself, or sells, depending on the quantity of liters that she gets from her livestock. 

Now she wishes to increase the number of animals she has, and improve her crops, in order to have good earnings. She belongs to the "Sol Naciente" communal bank, and this is her second loan with MFP. She feels fulfilled with the group, as its members are supportive and very hard-working.

In addition, she promises to pay her instalments on time. When she gets the loan, Josefina will use the money applied for to buy natural fertilizers for her potato crop.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Yorn, 55, is widowed and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer. All of her children are employed; two are garment workers and two more are on the staff in a rice mill.

Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Yorn is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for her children to use to commute to work. By doing so, her children can easily go to work on time and save some money from their transportation expense to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her rice farming and renew her house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to use to commute to work.

loans.name: Asmabeth

texts.en:
Asmabeth is 47 years old and lives in Digson Bonifacio. Asmabeth is married with two children. 
Asmabeth works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for eight years. Asmabeth has requested a loan to (Additional Capital). 
Asmabeth has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Asmabeth hopes to expand her fishpond.

loans.use: additional Capital

loans.name: Vilma Nelly

texts.es: Vilma de 45 años de edad que vive con su compañero de vida  y sus 4 hijos de 21, 19, 17 y 12 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que con mucho esfuerzo desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de antojitos típicos como: yuca frita, pasteles de carne, tamales, enchiladas, etc., actividad que realiza en la parte de enfrente de su vivienda, es así como ella genera sus ingresos económicos con los  sacando adelante a su familia. Vilma mejoro su calidad de vida con el crédito anterior reparando algunas partes dañadas de su vivienda y en su afán por seguir progresando ella desea mejorar sus ingresos con la venta de platillos típicos, además desea apoyar a su esposo quien tiene un pequeña carpintería y necesita adquirir un cepillo para madera, es por eso que Vilma solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lechugas, chile, papa, tomate, harina, yuca, carne y un cepillo para madera para la carpintería de su esposo.

loans.use: Para invertir en: lechugas, chile, papa, tomate, yuca, carne y un cepillo para madera

loans.name: Vista Hermosa Group

texts.en:
The Western Highland town of Momostenango is cold, foggy and gray but this has not dampened the spirit or resolve of ten women who have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Vista Hermosa” or “Beautiful View”.  The Facilitator  from the organization, who meets with them at their monthly meetings, speaks their native language of Quiche and conducts educational trainings with the women using games, role playing, diagrams and pictures. A different subject is covered at each meeting. The ladies learn about effective business practices (budgeting, accounting, marketing, pricing), as well as women’s rights, women’s health, nutrition and hygiene. The useful combination of small loans and education is called “Microcredit Plus”.

Momostenango is a busy commercial center and people from all over the area come into the town to transact business and do their marketing. The women of the Trust Bank are involved in various commercial endeavors and are pleased to see so many customers visit from neighboring villages. The President of the Trust Bank is 39 year old Pascuala, who was only able to stay in school through the second grade. She is married and has seven children. Three of them attend the university, while the other four are still in primary school. Pascuala has two businesses: animal husbandry and two internet cafes that her children help her manage. The businesses have grown and Pascuala finds it necessary to secure a loan since she wants to expand them even more. The internet cafe is popular but there are only a few computers. She would like to purchase two more computers, as well as have money to repair some of the existing computers. The loan will be of great benefit to this hard-working woman and her family.

Gratitude to KIVA investors for learning about Pascuala and the ladies in her Trust Bank in Momostenango. They are on the way to creating a brighter and more prosperous future, benefitting themselves, their families and their community. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase two more computers, as well as have money to repair some of the existing computers.

loans.name: Ratha

texts.en:
A resident in Phnom Penh city, Ratha is single and he makes a living through selling dessert, porridge, and mixed juice. He has been involved in this selling business for a year. 
He requests a loan from VisionFund to pay for tuition fees for himself. He believes that this loan will enable him to study Associate Degree of Real Estate and he can get a good paid job to support his family and himself.

loans.use: To pay for tuition fees for himself to study Associate Degree of Real Estate.

loans.name: Edidah

texts.en:
Edidah is a wonderful woman and is a very active member of Life in Africa. She is the sole breadwinner for seven children. She is very talented in the art of handicrafts and earns her living by making and selling beautiful basket, bracelets, shopping bags and many other items.

She faces several challenges in her work. The first is that she is an asthmatic. This makes it very difficult to work during the cold and wet season. However, she does not let this fact stop her and she works hard even when she is sick. These skills, her determination and her good business sense allow her to provide the basic needs for her family. Her other challenge is providing the school fees to educate all her children. Their education has become her number one priority.

To overcome this last challenge, Edidah has devised a plan to constuct a two room house that she will rent out. She owns a plot of land located at Mutungo near Kampala and she has family there to help in the constuction of this house. This project will take about three months to complete and once it is finished, she will use the income from this property to pay the school fees that will insure the education of her children.

She is seeking a loan in the amount of shs. 500,000.

Below is her budget:

  • Cement - 12 bags 200,000/=
  • Doors - 2 pcs 90,000/=
  • Wood - 20 pcs 100,000/=
  • Labour - 85,000/=
  • Bricks ((3500in number) 24,500/=

Total 500,000/=

Loan Amount 500,000/=

Edidah will be able to repay her loan in 10 installments. She has designated 25% of the interest she pays on the loan to support the WE Team for developing self-sustaining project at LiA, which she currently leads.

loans.use: Purchase building materials.

loans.name: Sowanou

texts.en:
Mr. Sowanou H. is a father of eight children. Widowed ten years ago, his main business is farming. Despite the rudimentary nature of his tools, Mr. H. never misses a growing season. The income from his business goes towards family needs. In 2004 he received an initial loan of $500 which he paid off with faultless regularity. He now wants to modernize his tools and buy fertilizer for his crops. The granting of this $750 loan will allow Mr. H. to improve his crops and increase his yield, so that he can improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur H. Sowanou est un père de famille de huit (8) enfants. Veuf depuis 10 ans, son activité principale demeure l’agriculture. Malgré le caractère rudimentaire de ses outils, Monsieur H. ne manque aucune saison de culture. Les revenus issus de son activité sont destinés aux besoins de sa famille. Il fit en 2004 un premier prêt de $500 qu’il a soldé avec une régularité parfaite. Aujourd’hui, il souhaite moderniser ses outils et acheter de l’engrais pour ses cultures. L’octroi de ce crédit de $750 lui permettra d’améliorer ses cultures et augmenter son rendement afin d’offrir à sa famille une condition de vie meilleure.

loans.use: To buy tools and fertilizer

loans.name: Miltha

texts.en:
Miltha C. already has a small general store near her home in San Pedro de Macoris where she lives with her son and two daughters. To improve the living conditions of her family, she is starting a second business, selling clothing out of her general store as well. This loan will finance the seed money necessary to buy the clothing as well as restock her inventory of food staples and household items that she is currently selling with great success.

NOTE: Miltha is a member of an Esperanza solidarity group. She and her business represent four other micro-entrepreneurs who are members of the same solidarity group who will all receive a share of this $750 loan to develop their respective businesses. Miltha and the other members are accountable to each other for making loan repayments together.

loans.use: Purchase food staples and household items for general store; purchase apparel for clothing store

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is 31 years old. She is married with 5 children. Her husband works in rose cultivation. In their region, the land is good for floriculture and most of the men in the area work in this sector. Maria helps her husband increase the family income by making tablecloths and napkins which she later embroiders. She belongs to the Rosas 4 group. With the loan, she hopes to invest in fertilizer for the land and also in thread and fabric for her artisan products.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA TIENE 31 AÑOS , CASADA, TIENE 5 HIJOS SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA A LA SIEMBRA DE LAS ROSAS YA QUE EN LA ZONA QUE ELLOS VIVEN EL TERRENO PERMITE LA FLORICULTURA Y A ESTO SE DEDICAN LA MAYOR PARTE DE LOS HOMBRES DEL SECTOR . MARIA AYUDA A SU ESPOSO EN AUMENTAR LOS INGRESOS CONFECCIONANDO MANTELES, SERVILLETAS A TELAR Y POSTERIROMENTE BORDANDO . PERTENECE AL GRUPO ROSAS 4. CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA INVERTIR EN ABONOS PARA LA TIERRA Y ADEMAS COMPRANDO HILOS Y TELAS PARA SUS ARTESANIAS .

loans.use: Craft sales

loans.name: Balay

texts.en: Balay M. is a 55-year-old farmer who lives with his three children in the southern part of Azerbaijan, Saatli region. Balay has 17 years of experience in raising livestock. Balay has a sheep herd and two cows. He sells sheep meat and dairy products, such as milk and yoghurt. These products are in high demand in Azerbaijan and Balay works hard to expand his business. He keeps his two cows more than four  years and he is going to sell them for meat production. Now he has applied for a loan of $800 USD to purchase one milk cow and cattle fodder for winter.

loans.use: Going to purchase one milk cow for $700 USD and fodder for $100 USD.

loans.name: Bambang Hermanto

texts.id:
Bambang Hermanto, 56 years old, born in Jember, East Java, and lives in Gilimanuk, West Bali. Bambang already lives in Bali since graduated from Mechanical Middle School in Java. He is doing it, because he has the aspiration to better his life, although he has to move to another place far from home. To channel his expertise, Bambang opened a motorcycle workshop. He is doing this business until now where he has grandchildren. Bambang lives in a simple house with his wife, because his children are married, and live with their own families. Because of his long expertise in automotive business, Bambang's workshop is always busy serving customers. Bambang got help from his son in law, who is also a mechanic. With loan from Dinari, Bambang plans to buy various spare parts to upgrade his facilities. This is to provide best service for customers, and so would bring more customers, and would directly impact on his income.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Bambang Hermanto, 56 tahun, asli kelahiran Jember , Jawa Timur dan tinggal di Gilimanuk - Bali barat. Bambang sudah tinggal di Bali sejak tamat sekolah mekanik ( STM ) di Jawa. Hal itu dilakukannya, karena ia mempunyai semangat untuk meningkatkan kesejahteraan hidupnya walaupun hal itu harus ditempuhnya dengan harus merantau jauh dari rumah. Untuk menyalurkan keahliannya, Bambang membuka usaha bengkel sepeda motor. Usaha itu dilakukannya hingga sekarang ia sudah mempunyai cucu. Bambang tinggal di rumahnya yang sederhana bersama dengan istrinya, karena anaknya sudah menikah dan tinggal bersama keluarganya masing – masing. Karena sudah mempunyai pengalaman yang cukup lama di bidang otomotif, bengkel Bambang selalu ramai dikunjungi pelanggan. Untuk dapat melayani pelanggan dengan baik, Bambang dibantu oleh menantunya yang juga seorang mekanik. Dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari, Bambang berencana untuk membeli aneka jenis spare part motor dan olie untuk melengkapi fasilitasnya. Hal itu dimaksudkan untuk memberi pelayanan yang terbaik bagi pelanggan dan dengan itu akan mendatangkan lebih banyak lagi pelanggan yang secara langsung akan meningkatkan pendapatannya.

loans.use:
To buy spare parts, and assortment of oils to upgrade his facilities

Membeli spare part dan aneka jenis olie untuk melengkapi fasilitasnya

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
At first glance, Grace’s shop is an odd collection of “stuff”.  Some pots here, some parts to smoking pipes in a bowl on the table, behind him on a clothes line one can see bark cloth, under his table is what appeared to be a large collection of weeds, and a rather large collection of various sized cooking pots. In the center of all this is the work table, a bench and Grace. Normally, one can discern what the business is when one walks inside, but with Grace’s business it was anybody’s guess.  When asked, he said he dealt in cultural items. Then it all made sense. Grace doesn't really deal in artifacts, his shop is more of a second hand store. And Grace uses his bench to make needed repairs to some of the items.

The bark cloth behind Grace is commonly seen in Uganda, used mostly now as canvas to paint on and to make items for tourists. But this was not its original use. Bark cloth has a long history of use for clothing and in the more remote villages it is occasionally used as such. The “weeds” under his table are herbs and Grace was proud to tell say that he uses them to cure people of illnesses, mostly stomach upset, nerves, etc.
Grace is 51 years old, has fathered 15 children with 3 wives and cares for 2 grandchildren. There’s a story in itself. Grace is requesting a loan of $600 to add cement, paint, and iron sheets to his business. These items will help him attract new customers. The world needs eclectic people like Grace.

loans.use: To purchase cement, paint and iron sheets for his business.

loans.name: Susana Antonia

texts.es:
Mrs. R. had to start her business to help the family increase their income. Her home was going through a difficult economic situation and she dedided to start a second hand clothes shop at the old train station.

With a big effort, she starts her business at the old train station with a small loan from her husband. Ceprodel has helped with 5 small loans which have aided Mrs.R. to grow the business. Profits are good and have helped her family´s financial situation thanks to the increased working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase clothing, working capital

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto Velásquez has been married to Sulema Araujo for thirty years and together they have four children. One is still in school and the others have moved out and made families of their own. Since a young age Ernesto has traveled with his brother who works in construction in Argentina as an assistant. It is through his travels that he learned the masonry and construction skills which have now become his profession.

For nineteen years Ernesto worked and saved in Argentina. When he had enough to buy the necessary tools, he moved back to Paraguay and began his business. Today he owns one of the of the best construction companies in town. With a loan he will invest in additional tools to keep his construction business up to date and running smoothly.

loans.use: To buy masonry and construction tools.

loans.name: Ushirikiano B Group

texts.en:
Saumu S., age 41, is married with 2 children (ages 16 and 9) She owns a business of selling clothes which she began 8 years ago. She works from 10am to 6pm daily making a monthly profit of around US$87.

In the past Saum has taken out 3 loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy more clothes for sale. She hopes for a new loan to open a shop for her business. She will share this loan with her sub-group members who are selling foods and clothes.

In the picture, Saum is in the middle back row.

loans.use: Open a shop for selling clothes

loans.name: Deyanira

texts.en:
Deyanira was born and raised in her small community of Herrera, Santo Domingo. She and her husband have three daughters, ranging from thirteen to sixteen. Two of them attend school, and the oldest studies at the university.

To supplement her family’s income, Deyanira sells men’s clothing. She explains that her husband’s income can’t bear all the expenses of the family and support the girls’ education. Deyanira mentions that she still is operating her business mainly from her house, but she hopes that her business’ growth will help her get money enough to rent a small premises.

loans.use: Purchase of men's clothing in bulk in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
I am Rukhsana W. from Faisalabad, an industrial city in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of four: three boys and one girl. One of my sons is currently working while all my other kids attend school. My husband paints buildings and churches on order. We need a loan to buy a few items so we can fulfill our recent order to paint a school. We want to expand our business to increase our income, which we will save to build a house of our own.

Sobia N. wants to buy a movie camera with her share of our group loan. Rubina B. needs this loan for her husband’s paint business. Asifa N. is borrowing for her husband’s medical laboratory. Shabana R. also wants to buy a movie camera.

loans.use: Buy a few items to fulfill an order to paint a school

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Mrs. Sabina is from the province of Melgar. About 12 years ago she decided to leave her town with her infant child in search of a better life. Since then she has resided in the city of Juliaca where she makes beautiful underskirts and sweaters using the knowledge she acquired as a child from her mother. She sells these products at fairs around the city. Upon realizing that she could not cover the school costs for her beloved son, she was forced out of necessity to foray into another business in order to obtain additional income. With the help of family and friends she now sells clothing in neighboring towns. Sabina’s wish is to continue to get ahead and to expand her market which is why she is calling upon you gracious people for support.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Sabina, es natural de la provincia de Melgar, hace más de 12 años decidió partir de su pueblo con su pequeño niño en brazos en busca de un mejor porvenir, desde entonces radica en la ciudad de Juliaca plasmando los conocimientos que de niña adquirió de su querida madre quien con diligencia al igual que ella elabora hermosas enaguas y chompas para damas para comercializarlas en las ferias de su localidad.Al ver que ya no podía cubrir los gastos de educación de su querido hijo se vio en la necesidad de incursionar en otros negocios que le permitieran obtener ingreso extras, es así que con el apoyo de algunos familiares y amistades viene dedicándose a la venta de ropa en los pueblitos aledaños a la ciudad donde radica, el deseo de Sabina es seguir progresando y ampliando su mercado, es por ello que recurre a tu gentil persona para solicitar tu apoyo.

loans.use: Increase in capital to increase products offered.

loans.name: Zenna

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 35 year-old Zenna K.. She is married and has two children aged 3 and 10. In early 2008, Zenna established her general store business. She opens her business six days a week, 10 hours a day. She is assisted by her husband and one employee.

Zenna requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of soap, sugar, cooking oil and spaghetti in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately US $40. In the future, Zenna plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of soap, sugar, cooking oil, and spaghetti in bulk.

loans.name: Karen Roxana

texts.en:
Karen is a thirty-six year old married mother with four children. Karen and her husband have motor-taxis that they rent to people that transport passengers around the city of Ayacucho. They originally bought one motor-taxi with their savings and loan and now they have three motor-taxis with plans to buy one more. Additionally, Karen works in a notary´s office as an administrative assistant.

Karen is a member of the Violeta Community Bank

Karen needs a loan of 2600 Peruvian Nuevos Soles ($925 US Dollars) to invest in another motor-taxi to expand her business.

Karen´s dream is to be economically established with a house she owns, to see her children become professionals, and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: to invest in another motor-taxi to expand her business.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia baji is the wife of M. and lives in the small area of Kot Radha Kishan, Kasur, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 9 years. She is a mother of one son. His name is M.Nadeem and he is 3 years old. Her husband is a vegetable seller and has been in this profession for the last 10 years. Razia baji is a housewife and takes care of her family. She has successfully repaid her four loans from Asasah (a Pakistan microfinance institute ). Now she is applying for a loan to expand her husband's vegetable selling business.

Razia baji is joined in her loan group by four more members. Haseena baji and Kosar baji each want a loan to buy a buffalo for milk selling. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy medicines for her medical store. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy shoes for her shoe selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Ly S. is farmer in Smaonh village in Kampong Cham province. She owns one and half hectares for a rice field and four and half hectares for vegetables. Since these fields are too large for her to cultivate by herself, Mrs. Ly S. decided to ask for a loan to hire laborers to work in those fields and she would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer to support those fields. Her husband, Mr. Say Yon, is a healer in the local village. Mrs. Ly S. is 51 years old and the mother of two children who attend the local school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To hire laborers and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Hasfa Nalugya's Group

texts.en:
Hasfa is the leader of a group of 5 members. She is 29 years old and divorced with 2 children, aged 10 and 5 years, who go to school. She rents a two roomed house where she stays with five people and takes care of her brother and his daughter. She gets some financial assistance from her former husband to look after the children. They have electricity, but no piped water at home. The family gets four meals a day.

Hasfa resides and works in a semi urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She sells farm produce in the market in Kasubi, one of the city suburbs. She uses public transport and purchases farm produce from the villages. Hasfa works seven days a week and incurs small transport costs for transportation of food for her customers' convenience. Her major monthly expenses include rent for the business premises, electricity, medication, food and school fees. Hasfa sells to an average of 30 customers daily. She has been with MCDT for five years and is servicing her seventh loan for a small eating joint. She wants to invest this loan in her business and aspires to see her business expand.

loans.use: To boost her business

loans.name: Maribel Rocio

texts.en:
Rocío is a member of the VilL. Huatatas Village Bank. She is 32 years old, married, and has two children who are 8 and 5 years old. Her older child is currently in school, while the younger one is in daycare.

Rocío runs a small potato processing plant from her home. She buys potatoes in bulk from the growers themselves, then peels and chops them using her processing machine and sells them to local chicken eateries and other restaurants, ready to be maD. into French fries. She adjusts the cut according to each restaurant’s preferences.

Rocío is requesting a loan of 600 soles to buy potatoes. The price of potatoes has gone up by almost 100% recently, from about .60 soles/kilo to 1.20 soles/kilo, so this loan will allow Rocío to buy about 400 kilos of potatoes.

In the future, Rocío hopes to expand her business. She would like to acquire a bigger space to work in, since her house is a bit cramped. She would then like to process more potatoes to begin working on an industrial level.

Rocío has been working with FINCA for about a year and has been a very responsible client. Her husband is also a member of a FINCA village bank, and has been working with the institution for several years now.

loans.use: Buy potatoes

loans.name: Bagnidoma Yawa

texts.fr:
Madame B. Bagnidoma Yawa est née le 1 septembre 1977 à Lomé, la capitale du Togo.  Elle est célibataire est elle n’a pas d’enfant, donc elle peut utiliser les profits de son entreprise pour subvenir à ses charges et celles de sa famille.  Elle a pour activité le vente des pagnes, sacs et chaussures, et elle n’a jamais bénéficié d’un prêt au près de WAGES.  

Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite va lui permettre d’acheter 30 pièces de Phoénix Pagnes, 10 sacs, et 20 chaussures.  Ces types de marchandises sont  très utiles pour les cadeaux pendant les périodes de fête à la fin d’année, donc la demande a actuellement augmentée.  Avec ce nouveau stock, elle peut bien vendre et servir ses clients.
texts.en:
Miss Bagnidoma Yawa B. was born on September 1, 1977 in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is single and has no children, so she is able to use her earnings to support herself and help her family. Her business is selling "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African cloth used for clothing, turbans, and to strap a baby on your back), handbags, and shoes, and she has never received a loan from WAGES.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy 30 lengths of Phoénix-brand "pagnes", 10 handbags, and 20 pairs of shoes. This sort of merchandise is very useful as presents during the end-of-year festivities so the demand has grown. With this new stock she will be able to make a lot of sales and fill her customers' needs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes", handbags, and shoes

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeun E., 46, and her husband, Mr.  Sophal Ung, 45, who live along National Road Number One about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1986 and have six children, three sons who are in school and three daughters who are garment factory workers.  As well, Saroeun’s mother resides with them.

Saroeun has been selling fruit for two years, buying them in her village for resale at a market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a house builder for 17 years.  Saroeun is now requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase mangoes for resale.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes for resale.

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Cette dame réside dans le quartier de totsi où elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale, elle  n’a jamais demandé de crédit à wages et demande son premier crédit d’un montant de 300000F pour l’achat des produits d’alimentation générale (lait, sucre, boîte de conserve de sardines etc…).elle a besoin d’acheter des marchandises pour satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle est mariée et à 04 enfants, son mari est un géomètre.
texts.en:
This lady lives in the Totsi district, where she sells foodstuffs. She has never had a loan from WAGES; she is requesting her first-ever loan in the amount of 300,000 F to be used to purchase foodstuffs (milk, sugar, tinned foods including sardines, etc.). She needs to buy this merchandise to satisfy the demand of her clientele. She is married with 4 children, and her husband is a land surveyor.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Mwamize

texts.en:
Mwamize has been a chicken seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 1 year. 
She belongs to Tupendane loan group (Group code 2001).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $250. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.  She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more chicken for her business. 
She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, improve her home and save money for future use.  

Mwamize is 33 years old, divorced, and has five children: aged 15, 13, 9, 7 and 1.

loans.use: To buy more chicken for her business.

loans.name: Murekatete

texts.en:
Greetings from Murekatete J. in the Kicukiro district of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda! J. is a 43-year-old widow who takes care of four children.

This entrepreneur owns a sewing workshop and also has wedding clothes to rent. Her shop is located in the Kigali city center. She has owned the business for 10 years and employs three people to help her with its operation. She works every day from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. and earns a profit of approximately 250,000 Rwandan Francs each month (about $325). With the increased profits that result from her loan, J. hopes to pay school fees for her children and reinvest in her business.

Murekatete J. is requesting a loan worth 500,000Rwf from Kiva's partner, Vision Finance Company s.a, which will be repaid over eight months on monthly basis.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Khurshud

texts.en: Khurshud B. is sixty-one years old. He is married with five children. Khurshud sells fruit and vegetables in the small village of Imishli city. He rents a small shed where he keeps products. His business is located in the central street of the village where he lives. He has been running his own small business together with his wife for eight years. Khurshud retired many years ago and his pension is too small to cover their needs. Income from the business provides for family expenses. Khurshud`s children are independent adults so all his efforts are to provide himself and his wife with a comfortable old age. Today he requests $1200 to increase the number of products he sells. Khurshud thanks everyone for support and promises to pay back the loan on time. Khurshud also keeps a cow and took a loan from AqroInvest to buy it. He recommended himself as a trusted client and has a good loan history.

loans.use: increase number of products

loans.name: Kikiafu 3 Group Mariam Nalubowa

texts.en: Ms. Mariam N., a 40-year-old single woman with five children all attending school, has been selling clothes for over 10 years. She is requesting the loan to buy more clothing such as Gomes’s to sell. She has managed to handle challenges herself and her dream is to buy a plot of land and construct a residential house.

loans.use: To buy more clothing such as Gomes’s to sell.

loans.name: Lucinda Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria.
Emilia es casada, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Emilia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos. Además por las tardes vende salchipapas.
Emilia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche.
Los sueños de Emilia son tener una tienda mayorista, mejorar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Emilia is a member of the Virgin Mary Communal Bank. She is married, 40 years old, and has three children. She has a stO. in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, and fruits, a job that she does every day with the help of her children. In addition, in the afternoons she sells sausage fries. Emilia needs a loan of 1000 soles to invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, and milk. Emilia dreams of having a wholesale stO., improving her business and for her children to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, and milk

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida C. makes a living mainly from selling fish to the local community. She is 39 years old, married and has one school-age child. They are from the village of Mobod, Oroquieta City Misamis Occidental. Adelaida has been in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Adelaida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Adelaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Adelaida is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Adelaida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business and support her family.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Zahir

texts.en:
Zahir A. is in the livestock business. He breeds livestock, which provides sustenance for his humble home. Zahir is single and helping his parents financially.

It's important to note that, since he started his business, Zahir has acquired an abundance of experience and knowledge because of his great dedication to breeding his animals. He is looking for support to purchase livestock to sell in order to continue with his arduous work with cattle.

loans.use: To purchase two cattle

loans.name: Itagia

texts.en: Itagia S., age 43, is married and has five children.  She has one year of experience in the ice cake business. She sells to the village people/public 7 days per week. She has had no previous loans from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).  SPBD loans are Itagia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. She will use her entire loan for her business. She started the business, but she needs more help to maintain and improve it.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, cordial, plastic cups, and chinese candies for flavor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate their house

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Men P. is a 41-year-old and a resident of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia, where she earns a living by selling flowers for ceremonies and other parties at the local busy market. She married years ago and is blessed with two children, one of whom is married; the other one is dependent on her income. Her husband, San Hoy, age 41, is a military policeman.

Men P. will use her loan to order more different kinds of flowers to better meet her valued customers' requirements. She proposes to decorate and repair the roof of her house, using the rest of the loan. Men P. was not available when we came to take her photo, so her daughter was photographed instead.

loans.use: To order more different kinds of flowers for resale

loans.name: Enecita

texts.en:
Enecita B. is from the village of Lurugan, Valencia City. She is 51 years old. Enecita is separated from her spouse and has five school-age children. To make a living, Enecita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, where she sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Enecita has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Enecita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Enecita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Enecita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her store's product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Enecita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her store's product offering

loans.name: Soro Yiriwaso Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Soro Yiriwaso est constitué de  6 femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Médine un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de  pagnes wax, fruits, pomme de terre, chaussures etc.  
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 25 pièces de pagnes wax,  40 paires de chaussures, 20 sacs de pomme de terre. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et  dans les localités avoisinantes. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au marché, de façon ambulante dans les quartiers, dans la famille, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 23.000 FCFA dont une partie sera investie dans les activités et l’autre partie en épargne.
texts.en:
The Soro Yiriwaso group is made up of 6 married women, who have an average age of 32 and on average, 2 children. They mostly live in monogamous families in Médine, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are on their 5th loan, working together with Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the intention of satisfying their customers’ needs. They have various businesses, among others selling African “waxcloth”, fruit, potatoes, shoes, etc..

With this new loan, they intend to buy 25 lengths of African “waxcloth”, 40 pairs of shoes, and 20 sacks of potatoes. They do their buying in the big market of Sikasso town and in surrounding areas. The goods are sold in the market, walking around the neighborhoods, or in their families, to a clientele composed of men and women, and mostly for cash.

They each expect to make an average monthly profit of 23,000 F CFA, of which a part will be invested back into their businesses and the rest put away as savings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: A country face family living by farming on a plot of land in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia, K. in the age of 50 years old had married to Sambath, 49, who is a local farmer and a palm climber. K. has five children; one is married and lives separately and the other fours are single while three among them are the students. She owns hectares of farming land derived from her parents. K. has earned a better income from her field. Recently she is looking for a loan to buy one plowing truck for her farming and plowing service.

loans.use: to buy one plowing truck for her farming and plowing service.

loans.name: Samen Mashgan Group

texts.en: Samen is the group leader of Samen Mashgan group. There are two members in this group. Each of them wants to take out a loan for expanding her business and making it larger. So they have requested a group loan of 24,000 Afghani. Samen wants to take a loan for her husband who has stationery shop. Shelaw wants to take a loan for her husband who has a vegetable and fruit shop. They admire this process of small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: For expanding their family's business

loans.name: Joserecto

texts.en:
Joserecto believes that success in business can be achieved if a person handles it very well. He is a 49-year-old married farmer with five children to love and take care of. One of his goals in life is to send all his children to school to give them proper education. He is very serious when it comes to his farm because it provides his family with food on the table, clothes to wear and also supports his children’s education. 

He requested a loan from CEVI amounting to Php12, 000. This loan will be used to purchase farm inputs needed at his farm and hopefully help Joserecto achieve his goals in life.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Surn

texts.en:
Mrs. Surn H. is a farmer who owns a 3.5 hectare field to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Keom Phon, is a laborer who makes a small income. Mrs. Surn H. has five children: three of them are farmers and the others are attending the local school. They live in Tuol Kandal in Takeo province.

In her farming, Mrs. Surn H. faces a small problem, because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizers to support the field to make it more productive. Thus, Mrs. Surn H. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Ayub's Group

texts.en:
M. Ayub has had a boutique in Bukamunye for one and a half years. He is a married man with nine children between the ages of 1 and 18, as he takes care of his siblings. He is a determined man and he is lucky that he is able to make 80,000/= profit a week. Before having a boutique, Ayub was a fisherman. He does not regret the change, although his business is affected by high competition. He ensures that he treats his customers well and has quality clothes for resale; hence, more sales. In the future, Ayub wants to be a wholesaler so that he can build a house for his family.

Ayub needs a loan to be able to restock his boutique with more clothes for a steady supply of products. He is the leader of his lending group in Lugazi.

loans.use: To restock his boutique with more clothes

loans.name: Mountaha

texts.en:
Mountaha is a 48-year-old married woman with 1 child. She has been working as a hairdresser since 2000. She has been involved in this sector for the past 14 years.

Today, Mountaha is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy hairdressing appliances needed for her work.

loans.use: To buy hairdressing appliances

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr: S. Bernadette est née en 1979 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Bernadette vit depuis 18 ans à Agblangandan, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Bernadette est mariée à AMOUHOUE David, un chauffeur. Le couple n’a pas encore d’enfant. Bernadette vit seule et supporte seule ses charges. Bernadette n’a jamais fréquenté. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Bernadette vend des produits de soins (pâtes dentifrices, lait corporel, etc.) de façon ambulante. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Bernadette fait ses achats. Bernadette a 4 ans d’expérience dans ce domaine, et est à son troisième crédit à ALIDé. Bernadette a bien remboursé les deux premiers crédits qu’elle a obtenus de ALIDé. Bernadette voudrait renforcer le stock de ses produits. Mais compte tenu du peu de moyens financiers dont elle dispose, Bernadette sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
S. Bernadette was born in 1979 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Bénin. Bernadette has lived in Agblangandan, in the Sèmè-Podji commune, for 18 years. Bernadette is married to Amouhoue David, a driver, and they do not have any children yet. Bernadette lives on her own and supports herself. She never went to school.
Bernadette works as a street vendor selling personal care products (tooth paste, body lotion, etc.) to support herself. Bernadette gets her products at Dantokpa, Bénin’s international market. Bernadette has been in this business for 4 years and is on her third Alidé loan, having repaid her first two. Bernadette would like to expand her stock of products and, given that she has limited means at her disposal, she is seeking a third loan with Alidé.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tooth paste, tooth brushes and body lotion

loans.name: Malienafau

texts.en:
Malienafau M. is 39 and married with 5 children (ages 6 - 15).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  Malienafau has many years of experience in this business.  Malienafau needs a loan of WST $1450 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 200 tala or US $83 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Malienafau joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Malienafau's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Malienafau M. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                2 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.99 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.99 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en:
Romulo is a rice farmer. At 61, he can still endure the work required at the farm. Although he has worked at the farm for most of his life, he still finds it enjoyable. He tills a 2-hectare rice field, which provides him with his income. He is a married man and has only one child who is now 22 years old.

Romulo would like to request a loan of PHP 6,000. He will use it to fund his farm: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: Mirtha Madelaine

texts.en:
Mirtha is married and the mother of two children.  She and her husband own a mini-mart in the San Vincente neighborhood in the city of San Ignacio Misiones. The couple is very popular and well known in the neighborhood.

By obtaining the loan, they will be able to purchase additional merchandise and increase the variety of their inventory. This will increase the family's income, so the family is very thankful for this organization.

loans.use: To purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Welina

texts.en: One thing Welina learned in managing a rice farm is continuous hard work and patience. She said that she faced a lot of challenges but was able to get through every obstacle. She also finds comfort in knowing that she and her husband are together for this journey. She has four children who also go to school. This is the first time she has joined an MFI. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP from CEVI and will be using it for farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Davaasambuu

texts.en:
Davaasambuu is 40 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a small house which they own. His older child, a daughter, is at university and his son is in secondary school. His wife, Otgon, currently operates a small construction business. 

Davaasambuu operates a Korean spare auto-parts trading business at a local market in the city. He started his business in 2005 and has built a successful operation with a loyal customer base. Today, his working capital exceeds 3,500,000 tugrugs (~ 2463 USD) and his daily revenues average 50,000 – 150,000 tugrugs (~ 35 – 105 USD). 

Davaasambuu is a very hard-working person and has many plans for the future. He says  “I would like to one day open my own shop so that I can financially support my children when they go to university." He is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrug (~ 1760 USD) loan to purchase a large amount of spare parts such as doors, lights, etc.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	
Este cliente se dedica al comercio de compra venta de cerdo y tiene 15 años a dedicarse a esta actividad.
El se encuentra ubicado en Malpaisillo de donde fue petronic 3 cuadra al su ½ cuadra al este.
Con este negocio más la ganadería que tiene ha logrado mejorar económicamente y le ha dado la preparación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
This client buys and sells pigs. He has 15 years of experience in this activity. He is located in Malpaisillo three blocks south and a half of a block east of where Petronic was. With this business and his livestock, he has been able to improve economically. He has given his children an education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and butcher pigs

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
El  Sr. Gabriel T. J.   es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio centro, tiene 50 años de edad, y esta casado con la Sra. Lidia Aguilar Acosta con 43 años de edad, Actualmente tienen 3 hijos, todos en edad escolar.
 
       Posee un establecimiento en la calle 8000 Bertoni, en donde se dedica a la producción y venta de leche, con clientela formada, tiene buen ingreso, buenas referencias  personales,  es un señor muy trabajador. 
 El cliente esta  preparando un lugar para construcción de un tinglado para los animales de su  tambo.

 
 Solicita un préstamo para comenzar la construcción del tinglado, como compra de  hierros, chapas.
texts.en:
Gabriel T. J. is from the downtown neighborhood of the city of San Estanislao. He is 50 years old, and is married to Lidia Aguilar Acosta, 43. They currently have 3 children; all are school-aged. He has a business on the street "8000 Bertoni" where he produces and sells milk. He has regular customers and has a good income. His personal references are good; he is a hardworking gentleman. He is preparing a place to build a shed for his dairy animals. He requests a loan to begin the construction of the shed, to pay for iron and sheet metal.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer
