loans.use: to buy iron rods, sheet metal, bricks, and other construction materials

loans.name: Absa

texts.fr: Madame Absa D. est femme battante de 53 ans. Elle évolue  dans le secteur de la  restauration (vente de petit déjeuner et déjeuner  depuis 8 ans. Auparavant elle vendait du riz  au port autonome de Dakar. Et du fait que le marche n’existe plus elle s’est lance dans la restauration. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus dans son activité c’est l’hygiène et la propreté  qui est assurée aux clients. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 150 000 frs pour acheter un stock de riz et de sucre pour les besoins de son activité. Ceci lui permettra d’acheter au prix en gros et d’augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Madame Deng est mariée et mère de 7 enfants qui vivent de son soutien financier. Elle est membre de la caisse de Ouakam depuis 5 ans et souhaite renforcer sa capacité de faire face aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Absa D. is a 53-year-old woman and a fighter.  She has been advancing in the restaurant sector (selling breakfast and lunch) for eight years.  In the past, she used to sell rice at the Autonomous Port of Dakar.  Since there is no more market, she started working in food catering.  Her greatest interest in this business is hygiene and cleanliness, which she ensures for her customers.  She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs CFA for buying an inventory of rice and some sugar for business purposes.  This will enable her to buy at wholesale prices and to increase her profit margin.  Ms. Deng is married and the mother of seven children, who are supported by her financially.  She has been a member of the Ouakam branch office for five years.  She wishes to boost her ability to cope with family needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Boosting her working capital

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina pertenece al banco comunal “La Unión de Ollantaytambo” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 23 años, natural de Anta de la provincia de Izcuchaca y tiene un hijo llamado José que tiene 3 años. Actualmente, Luz Marina trabaja en el municipio de Ollantaytambo como empleada de limpieza y su actividad económica complementaria es vender pollipapas en el mercado de Ollantaytambo.  

Luz Marina es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario salir adelante, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar una máquina de coser.  El anhelo de la socia es abrir un taller de costura lo más antes posible.  

Luz Marina se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Luz Marina belongs to the community bank "The Ollantaytambo Union" of the Arariwa Association. She is 23 years old and is a native of Anta in the Izcuchaca province. She has a son named José who is 3 years old. Luz Marina now works for the municipality of Ollantaytambo as a cleaning worker, and her complementary economic activity is selling pollipapas (a Peruvian dish made from chicken and potatoes) in the Ollantaytambo market. Luz Marina is a hard-working and entrepreneurial person who always looks for opportunities to advance herself through her daily efforts. She needs the loan to buy a sewing machine. Her dream is to open a dressmaker's shop as soon as possible. Luz Marina is grateful for the opportunity offered by the loans and thus she promises to make all the payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Luz Marina needs the loan to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Elbie

texts.en:
Elbie F. is from the village of Tinaclaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old, is single, and has one infant child. Elbie owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables, camote (sweet potato) tops, kangkong (water morning glory), etc., for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Elbie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elbie is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 20th from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with two adult children. She has a degree in economics. Tatyana is a small market vendor from Dneprorudnyi, where she owns a clothing business in one of the local markets. She owns a nice, spacious kiosk/store, which makes it very comfortable for her customers to try on different clothing items. Tatyana has been in this trade for over twelve years. Presently, she has 60,000 UAH worth of inventory; her gross income is about $3170 per month.

Tatyana is requesting a loan of 15,000 UAH to increase the assortment of inventory she offers for sale in her kiosk. She is planning to consistently develop her venture and see its further stable growth in the future.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of her inventory

loans.name: Bédéoouchatou

texts.fr: cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale, elle fait ce commerce depuis 1999, en ce moment elle est en rupture de stock et sollicite s'approvisionner, elle demande son premier prêt pour l'achat de divers produits d'alimentation générale. elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant, avec ce qu'elle gagne de son commerce elle contribue financièrement aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This woman’s revenue-generating business is the sale of food products. She has been in this business since 1999 and at this time is out of stock. She wants to stock up and is asking for her first loan to purchase various general food products. She is married and the mother of a child. She contributes financially to the family expenses with what she earns from her business.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of general food products

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en:
Japhet was born in 1971 and is married with two children; the first one is 6 and the younger is 2 years old. Only Japhet works in his family and that's the reason he has to work so hard to provide all the basic needs for his family. Japhet owns a small business selling phones in the city of Kigali; the hours of his daily activities are from 7 in the morning to 7 in the evening every day except on Saturday. Japhet has an experience of 9 years in his business.

Now, Japhet is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his business so that he can satisfy his customers. When his customers are satisfied, hopefully Japhet will be able to earn more profit to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: Expanding his business

loans.name: Beyris Patricia

texts.es: La señora Beyris G. es trabajadora de un pequeño colegio publico el cuál tiene  catorce años de desempeñarse como Maestra de Educación Primaria. Ha venido buscando la manera de mejorar las condiciones de vida por medio de la reconstrucción de su vivienda. El crédito lo está solicitando para comprar materiales de construcción y realizar mejoras en su casa de habitación para así mejorar su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Beyris is hard-working and active in the local public school called “Monte limar” where she has worked for fourteen years as a primary school teacher. She has had twelve loans from CEPRODEL and each one has been used to purchase construction materials and make improvements to her home. These improvements have greatly improved the quality of life for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials such as blocks, concrete, bricks

loans.name: Preciosa

texts.en:
Preciosa M. is from the village of Cabisera 8. She is 55 years old. Preciosa is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Preciosa owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members. Preciosa has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Preciosa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Preciosa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Preciosa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Dorcus

texts.en:
Dorcus is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a bus driver, and he contributes to the upbringing of the kids. She has been operating her open air food stall for the last three years, selling at the market to town dwellers.

With the Kshs 20,000 she is requesting, she wants to open a new business selling coral bricks. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation. She hopes to be a wholesaler of coral bricks and to earn more profit in the future.

She decided to work with Yehu to get a loan to finance her new business. She owns a house with no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To start a new business selling coral bricks

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en: Hanh  T. D. is 19 years old with 1 small child. She works as a wood carver. She is always busy with orders from customers. She earns 2,000,000 VND per month. To increase her  family income, Hanh wants to open a furniture workshop that makes tables, desks and beds.  Currently,she is requesting a loan of 5,014,000VND to buy wood for furniture making.

loans.use: To buy wood for furniture making

loans.name: Diana Elizet

texts.en:
Diana Elizet F. S. is 20 years old, single and lives with her parents in Romero in the district of Morrope, Lambayeque, approximately forty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Diana creates traditional clothing and household goods. She began her business four years ago by helping her mother and has since gained her own clientele. Diana’s specialties include traditional back supports and shoulder bags. Her goods are used by local agricultural workers and other residents of the area to protect themselves in their work and carry their daily lunch into the fields. Diana also creates tablecloths of splendid colors that are popular with her customers and tourists. She sells her wares in the town of Romero and in the surrounding area during the week and in the artisian market of Morrope during the weekends.

Diana is requesting this loan in order to purchase additional fabric and thread in order to expand her product line and to make use of bulk purchase discounts. This will be Diana’s second loan from our institution and will replace a previous Kiva loan through Edpyme Alternativa of $250. She was responsible and punctual with her repayments in her prior loan. Her capacity to repay remains good, and we have therefore approved her for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabric and thread

loans.name: Darisuren

texts.en:
Darisuren B. is 44 years old.  She lives with her husband and son in a ger – a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent – in the province of Huvsgul, in Mongolia. Her son attends a local high school, and her husband is currently unemployed. 

Darisuren operates a tailoring business out of her home. She has been working on her own since 1994, after having gained experience working in a clothing factory since 1983. She has made much progress with her business over the years and has gained many permanent customers. She sews a variety of items according to her customers' tastes and orders. She has used her earnings to support her family. In the future, she plans to have her own workplace next to her home. She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase a new sewing machine for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Salama Development Group 2-Mukono

texts.en: 34-year-old K. Patrick is affliated with Salama Development group-Mukono. A decade has now elapsed since he began his retail shop venture in Salama-Mukono.  He says he began this trade with the urging of a close associate, and at length, as he has operated, it is diligence that has brought success within his grasp. Patrick says he, by and large, relied on finances from his earlier farming business to start up this business. 150,000 shillings is what accrues to his business as weekly profits. With this loan, he says he is going to purchase more retail stock to resell.

loans.use: The purchase of more retail stock to resell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou T. is from the town of Surallah. She is 27 years old. Marilou is married and has three children aged 7, 3 and 1. To make a living, she raises pigs for fattening and sale. She also tills a small parcel of land where she plants and harvests rice crops. 

She joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Marilou is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and farm supplies

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha T. (in the photo with her husband), and her husband, Mr. Vit Ses, live along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They married in 1983 and have six children--three sons and three daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family home, two are garment factory workers, and the other two attend school. 

Mrs. Sokha T. has been selling porridge and Cambodian cake for more than seven years. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. In addition, Sokha also started new business selling fruit (mangoes). She buys them from her fellow villagers under contract before the harvesting season comes and sells them to a middleman who comes to buy them at her home. 

She hopes to expand her business, so she is requesting another loan of $1,000 to purchase more mangoes for resale and she will use a part of the loan to repair motorbike for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase more mangoes for resale and to repair her husband's motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of grocery store inventory

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 45-year-old married man who is blessed with six children. He has been selling paint for two years. He has employed one person in his business. Julius appreciates Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, for helping him to grow his business. This is because he uses his savings with Faulu Kenya to boost his business. With this loan of 20,000 KES, he will buy paint.

loans.use: To buy paint

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Luis Enrique L. G., es trabajador de una empresa de acueductos y alcantarillado, desempeñando el cargo de inspector de campo, tiene 1año y medio de trabajar en esta empresa.

Es casado, con 3 personas a su cargo, uno de ellos en edad escolar, vive en la ciudad de Managua en el barrio Adolfo Reyes.

Este es su primer crédito en CEPRODEL lo solicita para compra de materiales de construcción tales como; piedra cantera y bloques.
texts.en:
Luis Enrique L. G. has worked as a site inspector for an aqueduct and sewerage company for the past year and a half.

He is married with three children, one of whom is school aged. He lives in the suburb of Adolfo Reyes in the city of Managua.

This is his first loan with CEPRODEL. He will use it to purchase building materials such as slate and cement blocks.

loans.use: Purchase of building materials

loans.name: Santa Lucía Group

texts.es:
El comité Santa Lucía nació hace más de 5 años mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Este comité es de San Lorenzo, en estos cinco años de intenso trabajo han crecido tanto social como económicamente, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
La sra. Mirian F. es la presidenta del grupo, ella posee su propio almacén, para poder obtener mejores ingresos para su familia. Por eso solicita el préstamo para comprar azúcar, fideos, leche, carne, frutas, verduras, y también jabones y artículos de limpieza.
texts.en:
The Santa Lucia Committee was established five years ago with the help of another committee that was working in the area.  

After five years of hard work, this committee from San Lorenzo has grown both socially and economically.  The group is known locally for its hardworking women.  Sra. Mirian F. is the group president.  She has a grocery store as her small business so that she can generate more income for her family.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, soaps, noodles, meat, milk, baked goods, rice, oranges, tomatoes, onions, nail polishes, beverages, and other items

loans.name: Marizol

texts.es:
Marizol, tiene 38 años de edad, tiene un hijo y nació en la ciudad de Huanuco. Actualmente Marizol vive en la ciudad de Calca del departamento de Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal de Matilde es la crianza y venta de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y pollos. Ya son  varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Marizol en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar de 4 a 5 chanchos. 

Marizol pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Marizol is 38 years old and the mother of one child. She was born in the city of Huanuco, but lives now in Calca in the Peruvian department of Cusco. Her main economic activity consists in breeding and selling small animals like guinea pigs and chickens. She has done that for several years and earned a good income thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Marizol currently needs a loan to buy 4 or 5 pigs.

Marizol is a member of the communal bank "Señor de Huanca" of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided by this microfinance institution and promises to pay the installments on schedule.

loans.use: To buy 4 or 5 pigs

loans.name: Madelena

texts.en: Madelena is currently in a business of selling greens. She is 38 years old and married, with 6 children.  Four of them go to school. Madelena requested a loan to stock more items, like greens, to sell. She hopes to build a house with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: To stock more items, like greens, to sell.

loans.name: Ross Mery

texts.es:
Ross Mery tiene 27 años y nació en la comunidad de Yanahuara de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del   Cusco,  Perú. Ella tiene su pareja y tienen dos hijos. Actualmente, Ross Mery vive en la comunidad donde nació.  

Ross Mery  nos cuenta que la mayoría de los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, ella por ejemplo desde muy niña sus padres le daban tareas para realizar en la casa, en la granja y en la chacra entonces se podría decir que ella siempre se dedica al negocio de la venta y compra de animales menores y por su puesto a la  siembra y cosecha de productos agrícolas como por ejemplo papa, maíz y otras cosas más. 

Ross Mery en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar un ganado y pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Marcela  Virgen del Carmen” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Ross Mery is 27 years old and was born in Yanahuara community, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department, Peru.  She lives with her partner and has two children.  Ross Mery currently lives in the community in which she was born.

Ross Mery tells us that most of the people in her community farm and raise livestock.  When she was a very young girl, her parents gave her tasks to do at home and on the farm.  One could say that she has always been in business buying and selling young animals and growing and harvesting crops such as potatoes, corn, etc.

On this occasion, Ross Mery requires a loan to buy livestock.  She is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “Villa Marcela  Virgen del Carmen” community bank.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Zamile Group

texts.en:
Bhekisile is 50 years old. She is married and has 5 children between the ages of 15 and 30. Only one of her children now attends school. She also looks after 4 relatives staying with her. In the photo above she is raising her hand. 

Bhekisile has been in this business for 2 years. She sells matches, candles, paraffin, and phone airtime from her home in Eshowe, South Africa. She also earns income from the government’s child support grant.

She requested this loan through WDB and KIVA to buy matches, candles, paraffin and airtime. She says that the main challenges to her business are customers who buy on credit and then refuse to pay.

In five years time, she would like to see her business grow and have more clients, which will result in making more profit for her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her renovate her home and buy a car for her kids.
 
She appreciates WDB and Kiva for helping her and hopes to achieve more.

loans.use: To buy candles, matches, paraffin and airtime.

loans.name: Cerelina

texts.en:
Cerelina G. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 47 years old. Cerelina is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Cerelina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, junk foods, detergents, shampoo, soap & beverages in the local community. Cerelina has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cerelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cerelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Cerelina is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and junk foods. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Cerelina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods & junk foods

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a 33-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She operates a general retail shop where she sells food items as well as some children's wear and plastic items such as chairs. This is her primary business which she has been doing for seven years. 

This is her third loan with KADET after her two previous loans were repaid successfully. With this loan she plans to buy wheat flour, snacks, soda and to add more plastic chairs and children's wear so as to grow the business.

She hopes to expand and grow her business to a wholesale operation.

loans.use: To increase stock and acquire new premises for her expanding business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama, a high school graduate who is is married to a chain saw operator and has four children, has been selling soft drinks and provisions in Brasi, a village near Abura in Cape Coast, for three years.  Ama helps her husband to take care of the home and wants to expand her business and so is requesting a loan to purchase more soap, canned tomatoes, and other provisions for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, canned tomatoes, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.es:
Don José, de 34 años de edad, nacido en el departamento de Estelí, el es guarda de seguridad, al mismo tiempo es dueño de una pulpería que la tiene establecida  en su hogar tiene 7 años de trabajar como  comerciante sin  dejar de lado su trabajo como guarda de seguridad.
Don José cuenta que se sintió satisfecho con el logro alcanzado ya que con el primer préstamo lo ayudo a construir parte de su vivienda, darle mejores condiciones a su pulpería, compro más productos para su pulpería, pago mano de obra por la construcción de su vivienda. Ahora  vende un poco mas de igual manera mejoro un poco sus ingresos.  
El solicita el préstamo para comprar mas productos para la pulpería tales como dulces, azúcar, aceite para cocinar, arroz etc. También desea poder componer el techo de su casa y comprar material de construcción y seguir mejorando su casa poco a poco. Su meta es siempre seguir mejorando su pulpería y ahorrar para darle mejor condiciones de vida a su  familia.
texts.en:
Don José, 34, a native of Esteli, is a security guard.  He also owns a small general store that he opened in a room of his house.  He started the business 7 years ago so that he would have an extra income.
Don Jose tells us that he is pleased with his progress.  He used his first loan to make improvements to his house and make the store more accessible to his customers.  He bought merchandise to stock the business and paid for the construction work.  The extra sales have increased his income.  
He now wants to buy more merchandise--snacks, sugar, cooking oil, rice, etc.--to stock the business.  He also wants to repair his roof and buy construction materials so he can go on improving his house.  His goal is to continue building his business so that he can improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his retail store and building materials for the house that he's improving bit by bit.

loans.name: Harison

texts.en:
Harison is 34 years-old, married, and has two children aged four and seven. He has been running a welding business since 2006 and employs two people.  He sells metal and modeling, windows, doors, and other items that involves welding. Harison intends to use the loan to purchase more welding materials used in his business. 

Harison is a good client who repays his loans on time. He hopes to use the profits from his business to expand his small business into a factory that manufactures raw materials into cars and motorcycles. He dreams of being able to buy plots of land so that he can develop residential and commercial buildings.

loans.use: to purchase more welding materials.

loans.name: Regan

texts.en: Regan is 37 years old, married, and has three children who range in age from three to seven. For the last 18 years, he has earned a living by running a vehicle-painting business and now has three employees. He also runs a farm where he grows maize, beans, and sugar cane. He is applying for this loan to buy more seeds for his farm. His goal is to use the profits from this business to educate his children and improve their standard of living. In the future, he hopes to expand his painting business and his farm. Regan describes himself as hardworking, humble and friendly.

loans.use: to buy more seeds for his farm.

loans.name: Diana Marisol

texts.es:
Diana, es comerciante de ropa, vive con su abuela y unos tíos, es soltera, ella inicio el negocio por el apoyo de una Tía, trabaja sin horario, y por el momento todo ha marchado bien en el negocio.
Ella tiene la iniciativa de invertir en mercadería para aumentar el negocio, para llevarlo a cabo solicita un préstamo y comprar con él prendas de vestir como: blusas, faldas, ropa interior, esta compra le ayudara grandemente para atender mejor a los clientes.
Diana tiene un objetivo de superación y es el de instalar una tienda donde pueda estar fija, ofreciendo a los clientes una mejor atención, mercadería de calidad y moda, con esto estaría creciendo en el comercio y económicamente.
texts.en:
Diana is a clothes merchant.  She lives with her grandmother and some aunts and uncles.  She is single.  She started the business with help from an aunt.  She works with no fixed schedule.  For the moment everything has gone well with the business.

She has the initiative to invest in merchandise to expand the business.  To do so, she’s asking for a loan to buy articles of clothing like: blouses, skirts and underwear.  This purchase will help her much to better tend to her customers.  Diana has a self improvement goal: to set up a store where she can be established in one place offering her customers better service and higher quality, stylish merchandise.  With this, she’d be growing in business and economically.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en: Rose Marie is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Rose Marie has a retail shop that sells rice by the kilogram and homemade sausage, or chorizo. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy rice by the kilogram and raw ingredients for homemade sausage. Rose Marie is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Rose Marie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy rice by the kilogram and raw ingredients for homemade sausage

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro de 66 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Pítipo que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

Alejandro desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (ovejas y aves de corral), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada, granos y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles  para la compra de más animales y su respectiva comida, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Alejandro es un hombre que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño ha sabido sacar adelante a su familia, lo que le da mucho orgullo.
texts.en:
Alejandro, age 66, lives with his wife and children in his own house.  The house does not have the basic services.  It is located in the rural zone of the Pítipo district in the Lambayeque department.  The zone is known for farming, livestock, and handicrafts.

Alejandro has been selling animals like pigs and poultry for several years.  He raises them in corrals, which are appropriate and ample, that he has behind his house.  He feeds them balanced feed, grains, and natural fodder so that they reach their ideal growth.  That way he will be able to sell them at different markets in the area and get good income to pay for the family expenses.

He has requested a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy more animals and their feed.   With the income he gets from selling his animals he will be able to pay for the loan, and he will be able to have a better quality of life.

Alejandro is a man who with effort and great determination has known how to get his family ahead, and this makes him very proud.

loans.use: to buy more animals and their feed.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a widowed woman with two boys who have already graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing, electricity and school fees for her two granddaughters. 

For the past 20 years, she has operated a water vending business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also operates a food stall and a play station, which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of competition from other water vendors in the area. Everlyne dreams of establishing real estate houses in the future.

With the KSHS 80,000, she wants to purchase a motorcycle to start a transport business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to start a transport business.

loans.name: Sospeter

texts.en:
Sospeter has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 30 years. He is 56 years old and married to Rose. They have two school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He repaid his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Sospeter hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Geraldine has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Geraldine has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Geraldine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Raquelin

texts.en:
This is Raquelin.  She is 45 years old and is a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Rolando, a factory worker. She has three children, the youngest is still in high school and the two eldest are now working.  Raquelin, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.   

Raquelin owns a variety store. She buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar, and commodities that are needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and people from the local community.  She earns a minimum of 600 PHP in sales every day.  Aside from this, Raquelin also sews rugs that she sells to stall owners in the market.  

Raquelin is requesting a loan amounting to 8,000 PHP to help her buy more grocery items to sell and more materials for her rug making business.  With the help of God, she strongly believes that her business will be more prosperous.

Raquelin hopes that her business will continue to prosper and she also wishes that her family will always have good health. She never fails to attend to the fellowship* every week, as it inspires her to grow more spiritually and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy grocery items and rug-making materials

loans.name: Beka

texts.en:
Beka is from the village Geguti, West Georgia. He is 24 years old, unmarried and lives with his parents. 

The only source of income for the family is agricultural business. In particular, they own 2 greenhouses, where greens, cucumbers and tomatoes are grown. In the period of October – May the greenhouses are used for growing greens and in the summer months they are utilized for vegetable (cucumber and tomato) growing. Harvested greens are sold to local wholesalers. As for vegetables, Beka sells them on the local open market himself. Total average monthly income of the family is 950 GEL (approximately 575 USD).

Beka requested credit to purchase polyethylene material for covering existing iron construction and use it as the third greenhouse. Beka will be able to grow more greens and vegetables and increase the income of the family. They will be able to purchase needed household goods and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase polyethylene material for covering greenhouses

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is 26 years old.  He is married and has two children. He owns a small store selling vegetables, rice, beans, etc. and he has 6 years of experience.  His business is well-organized and he works from 6 am until 12 pm every day. Evariste currently employs 2 people to help him.

Evariste has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more quantities of rice, beans and vegetables to sell. With any profit, he plans to reinvest in his business and to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: buy more vegetables, rice, beans, etc. to sell

loans.name: Yaneth Del Carmen

texts.es: Yaneth del Carmen de 24 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposo de 30 años y sus dos hijos de 8 y de 6 años los cuales se encuentran cursando sus primeros añitos de estudio, preparatoria y segundo grado. Yaneth se caracteriza por ser una joven emprendedora y con muchos sueños de salir adelante. Con muchos esfuerzos ha logrado establecer un pequeño negocio sobre el centro de la ciudad donde habita en el cual vende variedad de prendas de vestir tales como: camisetas, blusas, pantalones, faldas, etc. En fin, si  de moda se trata Yaneth posee todo lo que los clientes necesitan. Además, su negocio lo tiene en un lugar muy accesible en donde muchas personas transitan y pueden frecuentarlo. Es muy carismática por lo que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de los clientes y lo más importante es que sus productos son variados y a precios accesibles. Su sueño es ver a su familia en mejores condiciones a las que ella ha tenido. Esto es lo que la motiva a trabajar con mucha dedicación día con día en su querido negocio. Ha tomado la  decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar variedad de prendas de vestir e incorporar a su negocio perfumeria, ya que la temporada navideña se acerca y es en estas fechas es cuando las ventas tienden a aumentar. Confía en Dios todo poderoso que de esta manera logrará su sueño y podrá dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yaneth del Carmen, 24, lives in her own house with her family which is composed of her 30-year-old husband and her two children who are 8 and 6 years old and who are in the first years of elementary school.  Yaneth is noted for being a young entrepreneur with many dreams of getting ahead.  With much effort she’s managed to set up a small business in the center of the city where she resides where she sells a variety of clothing items like t-shirts, blouses, pants, skirts, etc.  If it’s about fashion, Yaneth has everything her customers need.  Besides, the store is located in a very accessible spot with many passersby who can come by it.

She is very charismatic and has won over the trust of her customers because the most important thing is that her products are varied and at affordable prices.  Her dream is to see her family in better conditions than what she’s had.  This is what motivates her to continue working with much dedication day to day in her beloved store.

She has made the decision to ask for this Integral loan to buy an assortment of clothing items because the Christmas season is approaching and this is a season when sales tend to increase.  She trusts in God Almighty that she will see her dream come true this way and she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: Comprar variedad de ropa y perfumeria

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
Yeni sigue participando en el banco comunal “Ricchary  Runa” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Actualmente, Yeni  cumplió 32 años y sigue trabajando en la venta de materiales. Yeni también trabajando brindar servicios de masajes.  Yeni con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y obtuvo buenas utilidades la cual la invirtió en la casta familiar. 
 
Yeni requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como por ejemplo arena, cemento y otras cosas más. 
 
Yeni se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yeni continues to participate in the Ricchary Runa communal bank with the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.  Yeni is now 32 years old, and she continues to work selling materials.  Yeni also works by offering massage services.

Yeni’s previous loan went very well for her, and she got good profits, which she used for the family’s basic needs.

Yeni needs the loan to buy construction materials like sand, cement, and more.

Yeni is grateful for the opportunity provided through this loan, and she promises to make her payments according to the time line.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like sand, cement, and more.

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Vida Plena, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia la Victoria del Portete en la ciudad de Cuenca, este lugar es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la ganadería aprovechando sus grandes llanuras, también se dedican a la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres, su gastronomía es muy variada.
 
Doña María tiene 39 años, es madre soltera de 5 hijos de 21, 16, 11, 9 y 2 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su hija de 11 años está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad y su hija de 9 años está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad. 
 
La Señora María es de profesión costurera y labora en su casa, actividad que la aprendió trabajando desde que tenía 14 años de edad, labora solo por obras de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo. En sus tiempo libre se dedica a la venta de productos Omnilife y lleva 3 años en esta actividad. En su casa también se dedica a la cría y venta de cuyes, gallinas y cerdos.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos.
 
Su meta es mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
María is a member of the community bank Vida Plena.  She lives near the Victoria del Portete church in the city of Cuenca.  This area has a cold climate and it's people are dedicated to cattle farming, taking advantage of their great plains. They also work in agriculture and many work in the city on different activities. They have maintained the cultural traditions of their parents and their gastronomy is very varied.
 
María is 39 years old.  She is a single mother with 5 children ages 21, 16, 11, 9 and 2.  Her oldest two work and help economically. Her 11 year old daughter is studying at a school in the city and her 9 year old is studying in a small school in the city. She owns the house that they are living in.
 
María works out of her home as a seamstress, which she learned when she was 14 years old. She only works Monday-Saturday and doesn't have a fixed schedule.  In her free time she sells Omnilife products and has done this for 3 years.  At home she also raises and sells guinea pigs, hens and pigs.
 
This is her first loan from the community bank that her friend invited her to be a part of.  She is going to invest her loan in purchasing pigs.
 
Her goal is to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Vasale A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Vasale A Group in Western Kenya! Ruth is the facilitator of the Vasale A group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Ruth takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Ruth had a very good maize yield, harvesting 21 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Ruth was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ruth  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Ruth will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Vasale A group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a 37-year-old married woman with four children. The oldest child is 18 years old. Leonora earns a living selling food items to her community. She has had this business for six years. Leonora cooks viands and banana cue (a fried-banana snack) to sell. She requested this loan to buy raw ingredients such as pork and chicken meat, vegetables, fish and oil.

Leonora works hard to support her husband, who is a fisherman, in sustaining their family. Leonora hopes to be able to send all her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients such as pork and chicken meat, vegetables, fish and oil.

loans.name: Mahugnon As Group

texts.fr: Le groupement MAHUGNON AS est composé de dix huit personnes qui habitent le même village et mènent toutes des activités génératrices de revenus. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Annick est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Annick est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à un cuisinier du nom de François. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Annick n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Annick mène comme activité depuis vingt ans la vente des sacs de maïs et des condiments dans un quartier du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Annick sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement MAHUGNON AS, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The MAHUGNON AS group is comprised of eighteen people who live in the same village, all of whom conduct revenue generating activities. This is the third time the group is seeking the financial assistance of ALIDé, in order to increase the scale of their business. The group representative is called Annick and has her hand raised in the photo.
Annick is 39 years old and is married to a cook named François. They have two dependent children, both in school. Annick did not attend school. In order to cover her expenses, Annick has sold bags of corn and condiments in an area of Benin for the last twenty years. WIth the goal of satisfying her customers, and to increase her turnover and her profit, Annick is requesting a third loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the MAHUGNON AS group. The first two loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn and condiments

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is aged 24 and has been in farming for three years in his home area of Murang'a in Central Kenya. His farm produces coffee and vegetables which he sells to the local market. He says farming is his only source of income.

Jackson has requested a loan of 63,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow for a venture into dairy farming. He adds there is a ready market for milk in the region and he hopes to make gains that will enable him to build a strong foundation for his future family. He wants to have a farm of not less than four dairy cows.

Jackson is however aware of the fluctuations in milk prices which are the major challenge in dairy farming in the area.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo tiene24 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Santiago, distrito caracterizado por su clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial porque se cultivan productos como algodón, uva, esparrago, entre otros. Arturo es un hombre muy trabajador, ya que desde muy joven tuvo la necesidad de trabajar para poder apoyar a sus padres, debido a ello solo pudo estudiar hasta el tercer grado de secundaria.

Día a día Arturo trabaja como guardián en un fundo de su distrito, mayormente el trabaja de madrugada, y con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar con los gastos el hogar; él cree que está saliendo adelante en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y honrado.

Arturo está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar un pequeño terreno para poder construir más adelante su vivienda, ya que por ello se esfuerza cada día, para hacer realidad  uno de sus más grandes sueños:” Tener su casa propia y seguir apoyando a sus padres en todo lo que pueda.
texts.en:
Arturo is 24 years old and lives in the Santiago district, which is known for its warm and cozy climate.  There is agriculture here, such as cotton, grapes, asparagus, and other things.  Arturo is a hardworking man because he needed to help support his parents when he was young.  Because of this he was not able to study past middle school.

Arturo works day to day as a field hand in his district from dawn and is able to support the household expenses through his labor.  He believes that he is getting ahead in his work because he is responsible and honest.

Arturo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders and thanks to their help he has been able to buy a small plot of land where he could build his house.  He makes an effort every day to make his greatest dream a reality, “To have a house of his own and continuing to support his parents in all that he can.”

loans.use: to buy some land.

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Raymond is a 40-year-old married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 11 to 15 years. He describes himself to be an optimistic and focused man. He operates a tailoring retail store where he sells the clothes he makes. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity within the business environment. 

Raymond also runs an agrovet retail store, and this business adds to his income. He plans to use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy agrovet products to sell so as to improve the business . His business goal is to run more agrovet retail stores within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy agrovet products to sell

loans.name: Djromahuton Group

texts.fr: DJROMAHUTON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Mawudo Conforte est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Mawudo Conforte est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à Franck, un revendeur. Mawudo Conforte n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Mawudo Conforte et Franck vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Mawudo Conforte vend du maïs et des produits vivriers dans un quartier du Bénin. Mawudo Conforte s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir sans grande difficulté à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Mawudo Conforte et les autres membres du groupe DJROMAHUTON sollicitent pour une troisième fois, l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs et des produits vivriers.

loans.name: Khuvaydo

texts.ru: 38 летный мужчина Хувайдо. Он житель района Хамадони. У него маленькая семья. Жена и трое детей. Его жена работает учительницей в школе. Дети маленькие учатся в школе. Сам Хувайдо целеустремленный и активный отец. Он начать свой новый деятельность. Хувайдо хочет заниматься растениеводством. Он готовить почву к новому посеву урожай. Хувайдо обратился за кредитом для купли минеральных удобрений и семян урожай. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ему начать новый бизнес. В будущем Хувайдо хочет собрать здоровый и качественный урожай. С такими планами Хувайдо обратился за кредитом. Он надеется на Вашу поддержку.

loans.use: Для купли минеральных удобрений и семена урожай.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
"This business is a member of the Future Fruits group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff"

Peris is 40 years old, married with 6 dependants. She is the chairperson of Future fruit.

Peris started dairy farming way back in 1992. From the sale of milk, she was able to construct rental houses.
She distributes her milk to hotels both in Nairobi and Kiserian. She also rears chicks for sale. There is potential market for chicks and milk. Withdraws from the business to pay school fees retards business growth.

loans.use: A loan of USD300 will help her maintain the chicks and allow a normal growth of this business.

loans.name: Hoesseh

texts.en:
A married mother of three children, Ms. Hoesseh A. also takes care of her husband, left handicapped by an accident. She is a tireless and extremely devoted woman who works hard to bring up her children and who fights for their success. Her business is turning palm nuts into red palm oil, which is very popular and widely consumed in Togo. This seasonal activity is very prosperous because of all of the palm oil by-products that represent additional sources of income. Today Ms. Hoesseh A. needs a loan of $600 to buy palm nuts and to build a large stock of them to sell in periods of high demand. This opportunity will allow her to increase her production and her income so that she can meet the basic needs of her children, who are practically her responsibility alone.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, Madame A. Hoesseh a à sa charge son mari devenu handicapé mental après un accident. Infatigable et très dévouée, elle a le sens d’une bonne éducatrice et se bat pour la réussite de ses enfants. Elle exerce comme activité la transformation de la noix de palme en huile rouge très appréciée et consommée au Togo. Cette activité saisonnière est très florissante à cause de tous les dérivés de la noix de palme qui constituent également d’autres sources de revenus. Madame A. Hoesseh nécessite aujourd’hui un financement de $600 pour l’achat des noix de palme et faire un stock important pour être revendu en période de soudure. Cette opportunité lui permettra d’accroître sa production et augmenter ses revenus pour assurer les besoins élémentaires de ses enfants qui sont presque tous abandonnés à elle seule.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts to make red palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve their rice fields by building a dike to control the flooding.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a sterilizer machine, an electric shaver machine and more shoes

loans.name: Argentina

texts.es:
Argentina is single and has one daughter. She used to work as a secretary but her employer let her go when she became pregnant and she found it difficult to find other work. Unable to count on anyone else, she had to start her own business to get the things that she needed both for the birth of the baby and for what her young daughter needed later. That’s how she began her business selling tamales 21 years ago and gelatinas (gelatin-based deserts) soon afterwards. She’s done very well and can now count on the help of a sister and a sister-in-law to meet the demands of her customers.

Fortunately, the business has allowed Argentina to support her daughter and her daughter’s schooling. Now she wants to continue growing so she’s asking for a $550 loan that she will use to buy basic supplies for increasing her production. She promises to repay the loan in 6 months. You can play an important part in the life of this family by contributing towards the growth of her business. Argentina and her daughter sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Argentina es soltera y tiene una hija. Anteriormente ella trabajaba de secretaria pero al embarazarse la despidieron y le fue difícil encontrar otro empleo, no contaba con la ayuda de nadie así que tuvo que iniciar su propio negocio para obtener los recursos que necesitaba en el nacimiento de su hija y para darle todo lo necesario después, es así que desde hace 21 años Argentina se dedica a la venta de tamales y poco después incorporó la venta de gelatinas, donde le ha ido mucho mejor, para poder cubrir las demandas de sus clientes ahora cuenta con la ayuda de una de sus hermanas y una cuñada.

Afortunadamente el negocio de Argentina le ha permitido mantener y darle estudios a su hija, ahora desea continuar creciendo para lo que solicita un crédito de $ 550 dólares que destinará a la compra de insumos para incrementar su producción, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de esta familia, contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, Argentina y su hija te agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Buy ingredients and materials for food business.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
B. Rachel is a seamstress who has faced difficulties making a profit because she lacked enough capital to invest in the business.  Hearing of GHAPE, she excitedly decided to join and was trained in business management skills and credit discipline.

With a loan of $100, she plans to start a business sewing and selling dresses.  She believes the business will succeed because she already owns a sewing machine and has been trained as a seamstress.  The money raised will be used to invest back into the business and to pay school fees for her daughter.

She plans to repay the loan in 15 months with the first installment on the day the loan is disbursed.

loans.use: Purchase of cloth, sewing threads and to pay taxes

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married. She and her husband live in Zaporozhye, Ukraine. Oksana works in the Yubileinyi market selling cosmetics. She started her small venture 10 years ago. Today she has about $3000 in inventory, her working capital is about $2400, and her monthly net profit is about $1200.

Oksana is very determined and focused, which helps her climb the ladder of success. In a timely and balanced manner, she addresses key elements essential to overall business success. Oksana manages to maintain optimum efficiency and keep her customers happy. She knows that one unhappy customer can multiply into many, costing her profit and lost sales. That is why she tries to serve her clients well and pay due attention to this measurable and significant factor of her trade. At this time Oksana would like to get a loan of $1200 and hopes to repay it in six months.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria belongs to the Nuestro Senor de Martha II ("Our Lord of Martha II") community bank. She earns a living making and selling "churros" (a cream-filled snack). Her business is located near Caraz in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ancash. With this loan of 1,800 soles, to be repaid in 8 months, she will buy 15 sacks of flour, a case of butter, a sack of bleached sugar and a bag of confectioner's sugar.

Maria, 37, has 6 children. Her husband is a construction worker. Her commitment and dedication have made her successful. She now has 6 carts from which she sells her products and she's created jobs for her relatives, as well.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestro Señor de Martha II”, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de churros (dulce relleno con crema de leche). Su negocio esta ubicado en el paradero a Caraz, en la provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,800 soles, el cual será cancelado en 8 meses, comprará 15 sacos de harina, una caja de manteca, un saco de azúcar rubia, una bolsa de azúcar impalpable.

La señora Maria tiene 37 años de edad y 6 hijos, su esposo trabaja en construcción (obrero). Su fuerza de trabajo y dedicación ha hecho de ella una mujer de éxito, porque hoy en día cuenta con 6 carritos en donde vende sus productos y también ha generado puestos de trabajo para sus familiares.

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Client history: Ramiro has a vehicle which he uses as a taxi. His home is located in the Pampahasi zone in Said sector of La Paz city.

This is the first time that he has asked for a loan from IMPRO. The money requested will be used to maintain and repair his taxi.

His work and experience have allowed him to apply for this credit as he has already worked as a driver for many years and the income generated is sufficient to cover the loan repayments.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Historia del Cliente: Ramiro tiene una movilidad que trabaja como taxi. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Pampahasi sector Said de la ciudad de La Paz.

Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en IMPRO. El monto solicitado será destinado para el mantenimiento y reparación de su vehiculo.

Su trabajo y experiencia le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene muchos años trabajando como chofer y sus ingresos generados son suficientes para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Repair and Maintenance of his taxi

loans.name: Arelis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Arelis has been selling merchandise for more than 3 years. This came about while she was working as a maid and her small salary wasn't enough to cover expenses. She decided to invest her money in buying merchandise that she could sell in order to improve her situation and help her spouse with household expenses and school fees for her son. She's asking for a loan from CEPRODEL, who has previously extended a friendly hand by financing her business, which resulted in increased sales and increased income for her household.

Presently, her dream is to better the conditions of her premises and her business so she can continue providing daily financial support to the household.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Arelis se dedica a la actividad de venta de productos de pulpería desde hace mas de tres años e inicia esta actividad por iniciativa de que al dedicarse solamente al trabajo de ama de casa no le resultaba ya que los ingresos disminuían cada día mas y por tal razón decide invertir en la compra de sus productos para mejorar su situación y apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de su hogar y pago de colegio de su hijo. Solicita préstamo a CEPRODEL quien le extiende su mano amiga y le financia para su negocio obteniendo considerables mejoras que han permitido mejores ingresos para su hogar.

Actualmente su mayor sueño es mejorar las condiciones de su local y seguir en su negocio que le ha permitido obtener también el sustento diario de su familia.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị Nỵ is a mature and experienced woman that has always been the primary breadwinner of her family. She was one of the first recipients of a microloan in her hometown. Initially, Mrs. Lê used the loan for farming, but as the living standards increased in her province, she started a new venture. MaN. residents of her area now own motorbikes and bicycles, so she started a repair shop where she is able to employ her son as a technician. Mrs. Lê's instinct for business has been proven successful and it has increased her family income to over $200 USD a month. She would like to expand the repair business by borrowing $400 USD to buy more parts and supplies.

Tuổi đã cao nhưng chị Lê Thị Nỵ còn khoẻ mạnh và là lao động chính trong gia đình. Chị tham gia khi Quỹ mới bắt đầu triển khai trên địa bàn huyện Quảng Xương. Lúc đầu vốn vay chủ yếu đầu tư cho chăn nuôi và trồng trọt. Hiện nay đời sống của người dân cũng đã có nhiều thay đổi, chị Nỵ bàn với chồng vay vốn cho con mở cửa hàng để sửa chữa xe máy xe đạp. Sau khi có vốn công việc của con trai chị Nỵ ổn định và phát triển hơn. Vốn vay quay vòng có hiệu quả hơn, kinh tế được cải thiện rõ rệt. Nghề sửa xe của con chị cũng vững nên khách sửa cũng đông hơn các quán khác. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình khoảng 200-220USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị N. dự định vay 400USD để cho con trai mua thêm phụ tùng để thay thế khi khách có nhu cầu.

loans.use: Expansion of repair business

loans.name: Kristina

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 26-year-old Kristina M.. She is married, and has four children between the ages of 2 and 11. She also has two dependents, her nieces, who live with her.

In 1999, Kristina established her crop wholesaling business. Kristina requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of crops in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, the women lack tangible collateral assets, and financial institutions do not consider them to be credit-worthy. This leads to poor financial support and, as a result, limited access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys the equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional crops in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Thi Quy

texts.vi:
Mrs Đinh Thị Quý is 35 years old. She has 2 young children who go to school. She works on her rice paddy and sells bananas and other fruits. Her husband is a carpenter. Her family income is 200.000-300.000/ week.. She never had a loan before. She likes SEDA program because she would have to save money to make the weekly payment. She is requesting 2.006.000 VND to have more capital to buy fruits to resell.
- Mrs Tô Thị Canh needs 2.006.000 VND to buy feed for her pigs .
- Mrs Trần Thị Đường needs 2.006.000 VND to buy bamboo. She makes bamboo baskets.
- Mrs Nguyễn Thị Bằng needs 2.006.000 VND to buy rice to make rice noodles.
- Mrs Nguyễn Thị Thái needs 2.006.000 VND. She sells grocery.
- Mrs Đặng Thị Thuý needs 2.006.000 VND to buy feed for her pigs.
- Mrs Chu Thị Hường needs 2.006.000 VND to have capital to buy basic goods to sell.
- Mrs Trần Thị Đức needs 2.006.000 VND to have capital to start a business selling rice.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đinh Thị Quý (MS: 13020001),năm nay 35 tuổi. Chị làm cán bộ phụ nữ thôn. Chị không chỉ tích cực tham gia công tác xã hội của thôn mà chị còn rất đảm đang việc nhà. Chị có hai con nhỏ còn đang đi học. Ngoài làm ruộng chị còn đi chợ buôn chuối và các hoa quả khác. Chồng chị làm nghề mộc. Thu nhập của gia đình chị khoảng 200.000-300.000/ tuần. Chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu. Vì thích được tiết kiệm để trả góp nên chị tham gia chương trình. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để thêm vốn đi chợ mua bán hoa quả. Chị Tô Thị Canh (MS: 13020002), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám lợn. Chị Trần Thị Đường (MS: 1302003), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua tre, nứa đan đồ bán. Chị Nguyễn Thị Bằng (MS: 13020004), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua gạo làm mỳ bán. Chị Nguyễn Thị Thái (MS:13020005), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua hàng tạp hoá bán. Chị Đặng Thị Thuý (MS: 13020006),vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám lợn. Chị Chu Thị Hường (MS: 13020007), vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn đi chợ buôn bán. Chị Trần Thị Đức (MS: 13020008), vay 2.006.000 ND để lấy vốn mua bán gạo.

loans.use: sell fruits

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Originally from Ghana, Mrs. Abla W. was born on August 22, 1972 in Hohoè, a town located in Ghana. She is divorced and has one child. In the year 2000, in order to support herself and her child, she opened a little store selling staple foodstuffs in Agoè district in Lomé. The store is conveniently located in a place where there is a lot of going and coming which allows her to do a brisk business.

This is her third loan and the amount she is presently requesting will allow her to purchase 10 sacks of rice, 5 tins of peanut oil, 10 cases of spaghetti and 16 cases of peas.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Originaire du Ghana, Madame W. Abla est née le 22 août 1972 à Hohoè ville situé au Ghana. Elle est une femme divorcée avec un enfant. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et celui de son enfant, elle a ouvert au cours de l’année 2000, un magasin de vente des produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. L’emplacement de sa boutique située dans un milieu animé lui permet de bien vendre.

Elle est à son troisième cycle de prêt et le crédit actuel qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 10 sacs de riz, 5 bidons d’huile végétale à base d’arachide, 10 cartons de spaghetti et 16 cartons de petits pois.

loans.use:
Purchase of 10 sacks of rice and other staples for re-sale

Achat de 10 sacs de riz et autres produits de premières nécessités

loans.name: Holonyo

texts.fr:
Mr. Holonyo A. is a young man. Single, he has no dependents. He quit school for financial reasons and started to work the land, which is what his parents do. Today a big farmer, he is looking for ways with which he will be able to increase his yield. He hopes to seize this opportunity by asking for a loan in order to buy fertilizer for his corn. After selling his crops, he will first pay back his loan and then will use the rest to meet his needs and to improve his working conditions.
 Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.
Monsieur A. Holonyo est un jeune homme. Célibataire, il n’a pas de charge. Il cessa ses études pour des raisons de support et renoua avec le travail de terres qui est celui pratiqué par ses parents. Aujourd’hui, devenu un grand cultivateur, il cherche les moyens par lesquels il pourra augmenter son rendement.

Il espère saisir de cette opportunité par solliciter un crédit afin  d’acheter de l’engrais pour ses maïs. Après la vente, il remboursera d’abord le crédit et orientera le reste à la satisfaction de ses besoins et à l’améliorer de ses conditions de travail.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
O. Dilorom is 32 years old. She is married, and uses all the money she makes to care for her two children and provide for their education. Dilorom has 3 years of experience preparing and selling dried apricots. As a rule, she purchases apricots in the market and dries them herself.

Dilorom always makes very productive use of her capital, adding inventory to her supply in a way that allows her to meet her customers' needs. She is also very polite and considerate, and her clients are always very happy with the service they receive from her. Because her business is doing so well, she is increasing her net worth month by month.

Today Dilorom requests 600 USD for the term of 8 months. She is going to spend the loan on purchasing apricots so she can dry them, and sell more. With your help this will be possible. Dilorom expresses her gratitude for everyone supporting her and promises to repay her loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase apricots to increase her range of goods for her business.

loans.name: Kanoat

texts.en: K. Kanoat is a happy mother of three children. For two years, she has been selling foodstuffs like sweets, macaroni, preserved food, juices, soft drinks, tea, coffee and many others from her grocery store which she built near her house. Kanoat’s wish is to increase her business, offering a various types of foodstuffs to her customers who pass through those streets. She works with one aim in mind, to provide the best possible example and way of life for her beloved child, who is only 5 years old, who is the apple of her eye and the reason for her daily efforts. With this opportunity and with the immense love she feels as a mother and her desire to succeed, she is appealing to your generosity and is requesting a loan of $450 in order to increase her range of goods. She promises to repay the loan within 5 months. You can be an important link in the growth of this business by supporting her.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Ndague

texts.fr: Ndague S. est une femme mariée, mère de 03 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle veut prêt pour augmenter son capital. Elle s’active déjà dans le commerce de légumes sur petit étal au marché. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ndague S. is a married woman and the mother of three children, whom she supports as well as herself. Active in commerce in vegetables and already having a small display at the marketplace, she wants a loan to increase her capital. Her objective is to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy in bulk and resell various vegetables

loans.name: Saidat

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Saidat S. from Mwanza, a beautiful city on the shores of Lake Victoria. (Lake Victoria is famous not only because it is one of the largest lakes in the world, but also because it feeds the Nile River, a very important source of life for Africa.) Saidat is married and has 5 children between the ages of 8 and 19. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 1 dependent because he is an orphan.

Since 1989 Saidat has been raising and selling ducks. She works at the business for 5 to 8 hours per day and is assisted by her husband. Saidat currently earns about 150 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to purchase additional ducklings. Saidat thanks you for supporting her business!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional ducklings

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr: Salimata D., 36 ans, mariée avec 07 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Vélingara Bidiankoto depuis 1 an. Elle veut  renforcer ses activités de ventes de tissus teintés (imprimé et en couleur unique). Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Salimata D., age 36, is married and has seven children in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group Vélingara Bidiankoto for a year. She wants to bolster her business selling dyed cloth (print fabrics and solid colors). The income derived from her commerce enables her to improve her family's living conditions. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell dyed fabrics

loans.name: Samneang

texts.en:
Mr. Samneang P., 36, and his wife, Mrs. Sreysros Chhoung, 31, live in a small village along National Road Number Two about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They married in 1996 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. One of them attends school and the other two children are still young.

Samneang has been a motortaxi driver for five years. His wife has been a garment factory worker since 2001. Samneang lacks the money to purchase a new motorbike and trailer to drive "Tuk Tuk". Therefore, he is asking for a loan of US$ 500 to purchase a motorbike and a trailer to drive motor taxi (Tuk Tuk).

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and a trailer to drive motortaxi (Tuk Tuk).

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson trabaja como portero en la Federación de Lecheras de La Paz, tambien es pequeño microempresario y vende queso de leche; tiene una hija de 10 años y su esposa. La familia vive en su casa ubicada en la zona de 12 de octubre de la ciudad de El Alto.
