El crédito lo destinará para incrementar su capital, comprar mayor cantidad de leche y producir mas quesos de esa forma podrá satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene en su mercado.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite facilitarle otro préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Wilson works as a doorman at the Dairy Federation of La Paz, and is also a micro-entrepeneur who sells cheese. He is married and has a 10-year old daughter. The family lives in a home located in the 12th of October zone of the city of El Alto. The loan would be used to increase his working capital, to buy a greater quantity of milk, and produce more chees so he can meet the demand for his product at the market. This is his second loan with Impro. His good repayment history permits us to facilitate another loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase milk for his business making cheeses.

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate is a cheerful and jovial woman. She is a hair stylist and has been in this business for a long time. She needs a loan to purchase one hair dryer and hair styling creams. Kate is a mother of four, is 35 years old, and married. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase one hair dryer and styling creams.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama A. is 60 years old. She is married and the mother of four children. Through this business, Alimatu has supported all her children to finish senior high school and they now work on their own. Mariama lives with her husband at Bekwai zongo community in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Mariama owns milling machines in her community, where people come to mill their stock of cereals. Currently, she owns cassava, tomato, and maize milling machines. She happens to be the major operator in the area for the community. Of late, she has been losing a few customers because of the frequent breakdown of her machines. She has been operating these machines for close to eleven years now, and has lots of experience. She wants to purchase new machines to replace the current ones because they are giving her problems every day. Mariama requests a loan amount of GH¢600 to change her milling machines in order to remain in business. She believes this would help her to provide for her grandchildren. Alimatu belongs to a village bank called ‘Jordan’.

loans.use: To buy milling machines.

loans.name: Prisila Akumu

texts.en: Prisila Akumu O. is the 45-year-old mother of three children ages 16, 12 and 8. All her children are in school and she is married to a carpenter. She lives and works in Nyamasaria slum where she has a food kiosk. Her main dishes are maize and beans (Nyonyo) and porridge. She says she works hard so she can pay for her children’s school fees and is asking for 10,000 KSH to expand her business.

loans.use: School Fees

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua M. is a trader in Siwdo, who sells footwear such as slippers and gari, a grain-like food that is popular in Ghana. Gari is made from cassava, which is peeled, milled into a starch and then fried.  The end product, gari,  is ready for consumption.  Akua has been selling gari for 10 years. She is a widow with 2 children, who she supports. Her loan will be used to buy more gari, which is in high demand in the area, and to buy more slippers for resale. She hopes to increase her profit, which she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more gari and to purchase slippers for resale.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa K. works to help her husband provide for their family. Her husband is a fitting mechanic while she is a trader. She trades in all kinds of cereals such as maize, beans, etc. She procures the goods all the way from Ejura in the northern sector. Adwoa sells at the local market to food vendors and retailers. She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk.

Adwoa is 34-years old. She is married and has given birth to three children: two sons and a daughter. According to Adwoa, all her children are currently in primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in the busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast, in the Central region of Ghana. Adwoa is hoping to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure cereals

loans.name: Kwaje

texts.en:
Kwaje A. is currently in the business of selling rice, beans, phoso, etc. in her restaurant and is requesting a loan to build another room in her restaurant. Kwaje is 40 years old and married with a husband that is a driver. She has six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build another room in her restaurant

loans.name: Shammad

texts.en:
Shammad Q. is 44 years old and is married with four children. From the time he was young, Shammad has been learning to work in the small business of cattle breeding. After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching the business grow as a result of his sacrifice, and seeing his family progressing more and more.

His hope is to continue growing and improving his business to offer a better future for his children, and to see them as professional, ethical, and hardworking people. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of 1200 USD. He wants this loan to buy additional livestock.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en: Lusia L., 61, is married with six children.  She has three years of experience running a business.  She sells to villagers and the public six days a week.  She has two previous loans from SPBD.  Lusia expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Lusia’s only access to capital because she was not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Buy goods for her shop.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana trades in Ghana-made slippers of different kinds. She has in stock women's, kids' and men's styles of slippers. She takes delivery of stock from Kumasi. Kumasi is the center for most of the made-in-Ghana manufactured slippers. The industry has created lots of marketing opportunities for many Ghanaians like Nana.

Nana is 41years old, divorced and the mother of two children. One has finished senior high school and the other is still in school. Nana works very hard to help the father take care of the family. The goods she purchases are very expensive because of the quality leather and materials used. She is requesting a loan to buy a supply of slippers in bulk to increase her inventory so that she can save towards her children's education.

loans.use: To buy Ghana-made slippers in bulk

loans.name: Mrs. Sothea Prom Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan which consists of sixteen people is located in Tuol Pongro village in Takeo province. Sothea P. is the village bank president, selected by the members. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Sam Auk, is a farmer who earns a living from his two hectares of land which are used for cultivating rice. His land is not very fertile, so Sothea decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to increase production. She is thirty-six years old and the mother of two children who are enrolled in the local school. Mrs. Srey Yean C. does not come to take a loan but her husband does, so he is shown in the picture instead. 

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan's term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to increase production.

loans.name: Chapakazi Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma is a member of the Chapakazi borrower group in Msamvu,Morogoro,she is 21 years old woman,she is single.

Mwajuma started her own cafe business selling food 3 years ago,she works 12 hours and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Mwajuma first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy rice,cooking oil,sugar for food.

With the additional profit she gain`s from the use of this loan,Mwajuma hopes to save money,pay school fess and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities

loans.name: Martín

texts.es:
El señor Martín B. tiene ya más de dos años dedicándose a la venta de aceites para autos, este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
Al negocio le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía para autos, pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder surtir. 
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo y así su negocio tendrá más variedad de producto para vender y también  ingreso a su familia y con el cual planea pagar el crédito.

loans.use: Comprar de mercancía

loans.name: Volodymir

texts.en:
Volodymir is married and has two children - a daughter (9 years old) and a son (4 years old). Volodymir owns a small business located in a village close to Ivano-Frankovsk town. It is a retail business. Volodymir sells various construction materials as well as small home products.

Volodymir has been in this business for 5 years. He used to work at a construction site, but then decided to start his own business and opened a store in his village. This business is the only source of income for his family.

Volodymir would like to develop his business further. He would like to borrow 10,300 UAH to purchase 200 units of paint. Volodymir's goal is to increase sales so he can make enough money to finish the construction of his own house.

loans.use: to purchase 200 units of paint

loans.name: Latifa Shabrghni Group

texts.en: Latifa is the group leader of Latifa Shabrghni group. There are three members in this group and each of them wants to take out a loan for their business, to make it larger. So they have requested a group loan of 30,000 Afghani. Latifa wants to take a loan for the business of tailoring. Zaki wants to take a loan for her husband who is a taxi driver. Bibi Sheren wants to take a loan for her husband who has a bicycle-making shop. They are very happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: For business progress

loans.name: Denise

texts.fr: H. Denise est née en 1969 à Adjarra, non loin de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Denise vit depuis sa naissance à Adjarra et est mariée à DJOSSA Benoît, un mécanicien. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains seulement sont scolarisés. Denise et Benoît vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Denise vient en aide à son mari Benoît dans les charges de la famille. Denise n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Depuis dix ans, Denise mène comme activité, la vente de divers (tomate, conserves, pâte alimentaire, etc.) et de mil à son domicile à Adjarra. Denise fait ses approvisionnements à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Dans le but d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et de satisfaire davantage sa clientèle, Denise sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Denise H. was born in 1969 in Adjarra, not far from Porto Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Denise has lived in Adjarra since she was born, and she is married to Benoît Djossa, a mechanic. The couple has four children, of which only some are in school. Denise and Benoît live together with their children. Denise helps her husband Benoît in providing for the family. Denise never went to school. For ten years, Denise has run a business selling various items (tomatoes, canned goods, food paste, etc.) and millet at her home in Adjarra. Denise obtains her supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. With the goal of increasing her working capital and better satisfying her customers, Denise is seeking her first loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners).

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items and millet

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Mrs. Elizabeth E. is from the village of Magsaysay, Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 57 years old, is married, and is blessed with two adult children. Elizabeth owns and operates a business selling a variety of food products in the local community, earning Php 2,000 monthly net income from her business. In 2009, she joined PMPC to access its programs and services. Currently, she's obtaining her first loan of Php 3,000 which will be used as additional capital for her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her snack-vending business

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica P. is from the village of Poblacion, Catarman, which is within the Camiguin Province of the Philippines. She is a 42-year-old married woman with three school-age children. To earn a living, Jessica owns and operates a business venture in the food sector; more specifically, she operates a food production business. Her main source of income is derived primarily from selling a variety of snack food and "halo-halo" (a popular dessert in the Philippines) to her local community members. Jessica explains that she has been engaged in this business for over 20 years, and that she typically earns approximately 2,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2008, Jessica joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services; as a result, she was able to engage in business activities, and, in turn, to improve her family's standard of living. Importantly, Jessica has successfully repaid a previous loan in the amount of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. In fact, this loan that she is now seeking would be the fourth loan taken out by Jessica from HSPFI. Jessica is requesting another loan from HSPFI, this time in the amount of 11,000 PHP ($250), to purchase new items so that she can expand her product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City, and its mission is to assist the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing new items

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).
 
Vive en la comunidad de Batallas de la Provincia Los Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de La Paz. 

Su esposa le colabora con los cuidados del ganado y quehaceres  del hogar. 

Tiene cinco hijos de los cuales una ya salio de colegio y esta  estudiando en la Normal Superior de estudios para profesores; los demás  se encuentran en edad escolar.
 
El crédito lo destinará a la compra de ganado de raza mejorada (una vaca lechera) y así aumentar su producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el tercer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Mario raises cattle and sells their milk to PIL Andina (Milk Industrializing Plant). He lives in the community of Batallas, Los Andes Province, Department of La Paz, an hour and a half from the City of La Paz.

His wife collaborates in caring for the cattle and with household chores. He has 5 children, of whom one has graduated from high school and is studying in the Superior Normal School for teachers. The remainder are still of school age.

The loan will be used for buying a milk cow of improved breed and thereby, augmenting milk production, and consequently, their income. This is his 3rd credit with IMPRO and the evaluation carried out qualifies him to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY A MILK COW TO INCREASE MILK PRODUCTION

loans.name: Cintia Lisseth

texts.es: La Srta. Cinthia Lisseth H. C. de 25 años de edad, es soltera tiene casa propia de material noble y adobe ubicada en el Distritito de Pachacutec. Trabaja como obrera de campo en una empresa agroindustrial  con 2 años de experiencia. Adicionalmente tiene negocio de venta de gaseosa desde hace 1 año. Es una persona emprendedora. Requiere el crédito para terminar de construir su vivienda que fue afectada por el terremoto del año 2007 pero gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación logró reconstruir parte de su vivienda como también comprar sus artefactos. Su sueño es lograr construir toda su vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Cinthia Lisseth H. C. is 25 years old, a single woman who lives in her own solidly built house in the Pachacutec District. For two years she has worked as a field laborer for an agribusiness. For the last year, she has maintained a soft-drink business. An enterprising woman, she needs a loan to complete the construction of her house, which was affected by the 2007 earthquake. Through her own efforts she was able to rebuild part of her house and buy furnishings. Her dream is to complete the reconstruction, and have a better living standard. She is very grateful for the help we can offer with this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Housing improvement

loans.name: Viia

texts.en:
Viia F. is 53 and married with 6 children (ages 13 - 30).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Viia has many years of experience in this business.  Viia needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 200 tala or US $83 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2008, Viia joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Viia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Viia F. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.5 out of 3

You can view pictures of a typical plantation in Samoa, taken by a Kiva Fellow, at:   http://picasaweb.google.com/agnes.p.chu/SamoanPlantation

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Beddy

texts.en:
Beddy C. is from the village of Sibugon, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Beddy owns and operates a general store, selling daily-use products such as salt, sugar, "tuba" (coconut wine), shampoo, biscuits (cookies), noodles, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Beddy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and to use for processing her business permit. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. Beddy plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell and to process her business permit

loans.name: Tawopaneh Ii Group

texts.en:
Here are the members of the Tawopaneh II group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in the northern city of Makeni. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 for each to enable them to add more goods in their businesses. In this way, they will be able to make more sales and better profit. Consequently, they can better support their children in terms of feeding, clothing and in their academic pursuit. 

Beatrice C. (pictured left) is the leader of this group. She is 45 years of age and was born in Makeni City. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary and secondary schools, respectively. Fatmata sells market food: margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, sugar, plastic bags, butter and so on. She has been doing this business for many years now. With her share of the loan, she will buy more of the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current stock. 

(Attached on the photo is a group member who was not present for the group snapshot)

loans.use: Buy margi, salt, sugar, plastic bags, butter etc

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
“I have been farming for 15 years already,” shares Lilibeth. She is a 38-year-old married woman from Agusan Del Sur. She has six children and her oldest child is only 13 years old. She and her husband aim to have all of their children finish college and have a bright future. She helps her husband maintain their 1.5 hectares of rice field, which she wants to be productive at all times.

Lilibeth needs PHP 6,000 for her farm. She will use it to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies that her rice farm lacks.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies that her rice farm lacks

loans.name: Kuanputun A Group

texts.en:
Kuanputun A is a group of nine farmers from Bone Village – Kupang District of East Nusa Tenggara. This group is led by Oktofianus J., who is 30 years old. Oktofianus was born to a farming family. He is married and has been blessed with a cute daughter, Nadia, who is 3 years old. Oktofianus only has secondary education as his childhood was mostly spent on the farm rather than at school. He loves farming.

Oktofianus and his family live in a modest house. As a farmer, he relies on agriculture for income to meet his family's needs. He plants vegetables, tomatoes, chilies, bananas and coconuts on the farm. According to Oktofianus, vegetables and tomatoes are the most important agricultural products that he harvests and sells to traders. He works on the farm from 6 am to 4 pm every day. As the breadwinner, Oktofianus has to work hard to generate more income to provide his family, especially his daughter, with sufficient and nutritious food. 

Oktofianus says that he doesn’t have to sell his agricultural products at the market since his customers come to buy directly from him. His customers mostly come from Inpres Market which is situated about 37 km from Bone Village. They usually come to buy his crops every two weeks. The income that he generates is unstable. He can generate up to 600,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) over a two week period. 

Oktofianus has a goal to improve his family's standard of living, but he only has limited skills. He faces difficulties in meeting his family’s daily needs as food and other necessities are quite expensive at the market. This situation drives him to find other ways to better meet his family's needs.  Recently he heard information about the TLM Cattle Fattening Program that assists poor farmers like him. He is interested in joining the program as he has fertile land where the grass grows well for cattle food.

Oktofianus is requesting a loan of 3,200,000 IDR to buy a young cow to be fattened over a 12 month period. Just like Oktofianus, the other group members are also requesting loans to buy young cattle so they can improve their quality of life.

Note: Melkianus and Lodia were replaced by their family members when the group picture was taken.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened

loans.name: Zuhair

texts.en: Zuhair A. D. is a 37 year old married man from Ramallah. He is currently living with his wife and three children. He is also supporting two other family members. In 2006, he opened a coffee and fast food restaurant since there was a need for this type of business. Now, he hopes that through this loan he will be able to enlarge his business by buying some materials and renovating his restaurant.

loans.use: Restaurant renovation.

loans.name: Ayao

texts.fr: Ce monsieur exerce comme activité la vente en détail de CD, il a commencé ce commerce en 2008 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé, il n’a jamais obtenu du crédit de WAGES, il sollicite son premier crédit afin d’acheter 80 CD  audios et 150 CD vidéos. Il est mariée et père de trois enfants.
texts.en:
This gentleman’s commercial activity is the retail sales of CDs. He started this line of business in 2008 and gets his supplies from the main market in Lomé. He has never before requested a loan from WAGES, and is doing so for the first time to buy 80 audio CDs and 150 video DVDs. He is married and the father of three children.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy CDs

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal  Corazones Unidos está ubicado en la  ciudad de Cuenca urbe considerada la más bella del país por sus majestuosos templos y paisajes naturales así como sus calles empedradas, los ríos serpenteados, agraciados balcones de hierro, y bellos jardines forman parte de la atmósfera afable de esta ciudad histórica que  fue declarada Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad por la UNESCO en diciembre de 1999. 

María Mercedes  tiene 47 años de edad,  vive en unión libre y tiene cinco hijos de  27, 19, 9, 7, 6 años, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y vive solo con los tres menores que aun son estudiantes de primaria en una escuela del sector,  tanto ella como su esposo se dedican a la venta de comidas en el mercado de la Feria libre  como no tiene un puesto propio tiene que recorrer todo el mercado.  Tampoco tiene casa propia aún por lo que viven arrendando.

Se encuentra en su segundo ciclo y fue invitada por una amiga, con su nuevo crédito comprará  una carreta  y va arreglar  la que tiene para trabajar mucho mejor y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Su sueño es poder tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Corazones Unidos” (United Hearts) is located in the city of Cuenca, which is considered to be the most beautiful city in Ecuador for its majestic temples, natural landscapes, cobblestone streets, winding rivers, detailed wrought iron balconies, and beautiful gardens. All of these elements help shape the friendly atmosphere of this historic city, which was declared a World Heritage Site by UNESCO in December 1999.

María Mercedes is 47 years old, in a common law marriage, and has five children (ages 27, 19, 9, 7, and 6). Her two oldest children are married and she lives with the three younger children, who attend the local elementary school. María and her husband sell food at the open market, but she walks around the entire market since she does not have her own vending stall. Her family rents their home since they do not own a house.

María is in her second loan cycle and was invited to join the Communal Bank by a friend. With her new loan, she will buy a cart to repair so that she can perform her job better and provide improved service to her customers.

Her dream is to have a house of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a food cart to use for her business

loans.name: Marvin Ramon

texts.es:
Marvin tiene 47 años y tiene un servicio de video juegos en su casa.  El inicio su negocio hace 7 años  con 2 televisores y 2 video juegos.  Ahora el posee 8 televisores y 9 video juegos.  Gracias al aumento en equipaje, Marvin ahora tiene más clientes y también más ingresos mensuales.

Marvin ha recibido 5 préstamos hasta la fecha y estos los ha utilizado en compra de equipos para su negocio.  Con las inversiones ha logrado mejorar du nivel de vida y también sacar adelante a sus hijos tanto en educación como también en su economía familiar.

Marvin está casado y tiene hijos de quien ya están en la universidad.  La meta para su negocio es comprar más video juegos y un día, establecerse en otros puntos de la ciudad de El Viejo.
texts.en:
Marvin is 47 years old. He has a video game service in his house. Seven years ago he started his business with two televisions and two video games. He now has eight televisions and nine games. Thanks to the increase in equipment, Marvin now has more customers. He also has more monthly income. Marvin has received five loans up to this date. He has used these to buy equipment for his business. With the investments he has improved his standard of living. He has also gotten his children ahead as much with their education as with their family’s economy. Marvin is married and has children who are in the university. His goal for his business is to buy more video games and to one day establish himself in other spots in the city of El Viejo.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy equipment for video games

loans.name: Florencio J

texts.en:
Florencio J L., from the village of Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur, is 28 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Florencio J owns and operates a business venture providing motor transport services. Engaged in his business for over three years, he earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Florencio J joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC, he is now requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to repair his vehicle for better service. This will be his second loan from GDMPC, and he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.fr: Monsieur Moustapha F. est un sociétaire  de 44 ans qui vit dans la localité de Déni  Birame  Ndao dans la communauté  rurale de Bambilor. Il est membre de la caisse depuis janvier 2010. Il est marie et père  de 5 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 3 mois et 8 ans. Il évolue  dans le commerce  de sel et parallèlement  aussi   il pratique l’agriculture basée  sur la culture de persils, piments, etc. Il a choisi ces activités  a cause de leur aspect lucratif. Il sollicite un  crédit de 300 000 frs dans le but de renforcer son activité  de commerce de sel. Ce crédit  pourra lui permettre d’accroitre ses bénéfices et de mieux prendre en charge la dépense  quotidienne et les  autres besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Moustapha F. is 44 years old and lives in the Déni Birame Ndao locality in the rural community of Bambilor. He has been a member of the local group fund since January 2010. He is married and has 5 children, whose ages vary from 3 months to 8 years. He has developed a business selling salt, and at the same time is also involved in farming parsley, peppers, etc. He chose these businesses because of their lucrative nature. He is seeking a loan of 300,000 frs with the goal of strengthening his salt business. This loan will allow him to increase his profits and better provide for his family's needs and daily expenses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es:
Luis Carlos A. Z. es un joven de 24 años que vive en la zona central de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Vive en casa de sus padres junto a su hermano y su hermana menor. Luis y su hermano acuden a la Universidad y por las noches a un instituto para convertirse en Chefs.
Todos juntos tienen un restaurant de comida tradicional de Cochabamba por más de 30 años y son un restaurant muy conocido en la ciudad por su calidad y limpieza. Luis necesita el préstamo para poder renovar sus utensilios de cocina que tiene puesto que estos ya están muy usados. 
El nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es poder en un futuro abrir sucursales de su Restaurant por todo Bolivia y de esa manera lograr cumplir el sueño que está pendiente de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Luis Carlos A. Z. is a youth of 24 years of age who lives in the central area of the city of Cochabamba. He lives in his parent's home with his brother and his younger sister. Luis and his brother attend the University, and at night they study to become chefs. The family has had a restaurant in Cochabamba that serves traditional food for more than 30 years, and it is a restaurant that is well known in the city for its quality and cleanliness. Luis needs a loan to replace his kitchen utensils, because the ones he has are very old. He tells us that his main dream is to be able to open branches of his restaurant throughout Bolivia, and in this way manage to accomplish a dream that his whole family would like to see become reality.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils for his family restaurant

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene was born in 1982. He is single. He is the only one in his family who works. For that reason, Eugene works hard in order to provide everything necessary for his family. Eugene owns a small business selling various products such as cooking oil, bread, cosmetic products and so on. Eugene is seasoned in his business because he has three years of experience. He employs one person from his community as a helper. The hours of his shop are from 6 in the morning to 10 in evening every day.

Eugene is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing more products for his shop. Eugene hopes to earn more profits, which will allow him to save money for his future.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: 03.01.23 Dien Bien Group

texts.en:
Hoa T. T. (114) is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Hoa is the group leader of a 8-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 23-Cho Dien Bien (03.01.23Dien Bien).

Hoa is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, Hoa owns & operates a tailoring business.  The main source of income for the business comes from providing general alteration & tailoring services to local community members.  Hoa has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month from it.

In 2009, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business.  Hoa has successfully repaid her first loan of 4,248,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to renovate the business.  She is now requesting her second loan, for 5,310,000 VND, which will again be used for business renovation.  Hoa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  T. T. Phuc (115) is a 52 year-old woman who is requesting a 5,310,000 VND loan to support her tailoring business.


2.  N. T. Phuong (173) is a 32 year-old woman who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her tailoring business.


3.  N. T. Thu (172) is a 39 year-old woman who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her tailoring business.


4.  N. T. H. Ha (171) is a 41 year-old woman who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her tailoring business.


5.  N. T. H. Nga (121) is a 42 year-old woman who is requesting a 5,310,000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.


6.  N. T. Tam (123) is a 31 year-old woman who is requesting a 5,310,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.


7.  N. T. Ngoc (122) is a 46 year-old woman who is requesting a 5,310,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hoa T. T. (114) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Hoa là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 23- Cho Dien Bien (03.01.23Dien Bien).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ may vá quần áo thông thường cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hoa thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hoa kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Hoa đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hoa đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.248.000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư đổi mới công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.310.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  T. T. Phuc (115) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.310.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


2.  N. T. Phuong (173) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


3.  N. T. Thu (172) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


4.  N. T. H. Ha (171) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


5.  N. T. H. Nga (121) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.310.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


6.  N. T. Tam (123) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.310.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


7.  N. T. Ngoc (122) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.310.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: business renovation

loans.name: Marn

texts.en: Marn S., 55, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. S. is a housewife while her husband is a taxi driver, earning an income of USD 10 per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to repair the car. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband appears in the photograph because S. was not available.

loans.use: to repair the car

loans.name: Mehrovar

texts.en: S. Mehrovar is 21 years old and single. He sells women's shoes and clothing for teenagers in the central market of Dushanbe. For three years, he has maintained his clientele. Mehrovar‘s business is the main source of income allowing him to improve his family's living conditions and provide them with food. He requests 4,000 somoni to purchase new goods in order to increase his variety. Mehrovar would like to thank everyone for support and promises to repay the loan on time. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing in order to increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita O. lives in the village of Brgy. Lantap, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 54 years old, married, has six grown children and makes a living by raising pigs. She has been in this business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2006, Perlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for a loan, her first, for 10,000 PHP, to buy livestock, feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern parts of the country. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy livestock, feed and other supplies

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo, de 59 años, es un hombre líder y responsable, casado y producto de su amor tuvo 3 hijos; los que son su dicha y alegría; ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Huaracayo. Hace 40 años que se dedica a la siembra de maíz del cuzco (una variedad híbrida del maíz, cuyos granos son más grandes y ricos), lechuga, espinaca y col. Lo que más le gusta de la agricultura es poder sembrar y cuidar los productos que la naturaleza le brinda; con ello asegura la calidad de sus cultivos; de la misma manera tiene una pequeña huerta en su casa donde siembra limones, que son los más grandes y jugosos de su localidad.  Guillermo también se dedica a la compra y venta de carros; compra a un precio determinado y lo vende a un precio mayor, ese transacción le genera muchas utilidades. Gracias a su buen juicio en los negocios, Guillermo puede ahorrar para comprar más terrenos de cultivo, en los cuales está pensando sembrar mayor cantidad de hortalizas. Es el décimo crédito con MFP y como autoridad de su banco comunal se siente muy orgulloso de poder ayudar a las personas, que como él quieren salir adelante. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará abono, fertilizantes, medicinas para cuidar su cultivo de maíz.
texts.en:
Guillermo, age 59, is responsible and a leader, married, and as a product of this love, he has 3 children.  They are his joy and happiness.  They live in his  house located in the town of Huaracayo.  For 40 years, he has worked by planting cuzco corn (a hybrid variety of corn whose kernels are bigger and tastier), lettuce, spinach, and cabbage. What he most likes about farming is to be able to plant and care for the goods nature gives him. Through his care, he assures the quality of his crops.  In the same way, he has a small garden near his house where he plants lemons which are the biggest and juiciest in town. Guillermo also works by  buying and selling from a cart.  He buys at a certain price and then sells at a higher price. This transaction creates a lot of money. Thanks to his good business judgement, Guillermo saved money to buy more land to cultivate in which he is thinking about planting a greater quantity of vegetables. 

This is his tenth credit with MFP and as an authority of his community bank, we feel prideful to be able to help people that, like him, want to prosper.  With the asked for loan, he will buy fertilizer and medicine to care for his crop of corn.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and medicine for his crop of corn.

loans.name: Oyungerel

texts.en:
Oyungerel T. is 32 years old and lives with her two children in Arvaiheer city of the Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in her sister's yard. Her two children attend a local secondary school. 

Oyungerel manages a clothing trade business in her town. She started her clothing business in 2009 with the help of her sister and since then, has built a stable and successful operation. Before she moved to her current town, she used to live and work in the Uyanga sub province with her two children. Her sister, Tungalag, brought them to Arvaiheer in order to improve their quality of life. 

After growing her business in this short period, her success has enabled her to operate her business individually. For the future, Oyungerel hopes to continue to grow her business and says, "All I want is to support my children and raise them to become a good people. I try my best to make success with my new business." 

She is requesting a 1,000,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to purchase more winter clothes for the upcoming cold season.

loans.use: To purchase more winter clothes

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma A. lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 7 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (two orphans ).  

Fatuma has a business selling fruits and vegetables.  She has been in this business for less than one year, and she works 7 days out of every week. Fatuma sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale/retail.  Fatuma has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of oranges, Mangoes, pineapples and cabbages.  

She also generates additional income through selling piped water and computer services.  The main business challenges for Fatuma include seasonality and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on wholesale only and start going directly to farmers . Fatuma lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, medication and school fees .

loans.use: To buy more boxes of oranges, cabbages, mangoes  and pineapples.

loans.name: Sumaya

texts.en:
Sumaya N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Sumaya has a business of selling vegetables, which she has had for over 10 years. She owns a motor bike.  

To help expand her business, Sumaya has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase vegetables.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sumaya hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Sumaya hopes to own a retail shop.        Sumaya is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to work hard.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Zina

texts.ar:
زينه في عمر 43 سنة  تعمل في مجال بيع الألعاب والهدايا للأطفال زينه طموحة تحب عملها وتسعى الى تطوير مصلحتها
زينه متطورة ونشيطة بالعمل تعمل اكثر من 4 سنوات تلقى دعم كبير من العائلة تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة العاب 
جديدة وتسديد للتجار لكي تزيد من البضائع بسبب موسم الأعياد زينه تعتمد على مصلحتها لكي تساعد عائلتها فهي تعيل والدتها واهلها تتلقى دائما
الدعم منهم ويحبونها كثيرا
texts.en: Zina, 43, works in selling children's toys and gifts. She is ambitious, likes her work and seeks to develop her business. Zina has been working in this field for 4 years. She is active and wants to stay up to date in her work. She enjoys great support from her family. Zina wants to get a loan from Al Majmoua to buy new stock for the feast season and to pay for the goods she gets from wholesalers. Zina works to support her mother and family. Her family loves her very much and always supports her.

loans.use: To buy toys to stock for the feast season

loans.name: Segundo Cristobal

texts.en:
Segundo is 28 years old.  He lives in the region of Oyotun, which is located in northern Peru.  Oyotun is an agricultural region located in a large valley that feeds out into the costal desert of northern Peru.  It has a river that passes through the area and a relatively high water table providing good agricultural opportunities.  It is fairly isolated, located approximately one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.  Segundo lives with his partner and their one child in a family home.

For the last two years, Segundo has driven a mototaxi in the zone.  He carries workers and residents to work and/or to complete shopping trips.  He also at times carries cargo such as building supplies or crops as needed by his clients.

Segundo has not worked with Edpyme Alternativa in the past.  He has good references from the community.  He plans to use the loan proceeds to complete repairs and general maintenance on his mototaxi.  He hopes this action will reduce his ongoing expenses and ensure that the vehicle is available to continue earning income for his family.  He dreams of expanding the business and owning his own property so that his family can grow independently.

loans.use: To complete repairs and general maintenance on his mototaxi.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 44 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa que es propia, junto a su esposo, y sus dos hijos, que  aún estudian.Rosa, se dedica a la preparación y venta de papas rellenas (de carne molida)  en la puerta de un colegio muy popular de su distrito, y  esta situado a siete  cuadras de su casa. Ella sancocha las papas, luego las aplasta uniformemente, y después las enrolla con el aderezo de carne dentro y por ultimo las  fríe en aceite caliente. Después, carga todas las papas en su fuente grande y se ubica en la puerta del colegio, donde los alumnos del colegio le compran sus papas rellenas. De esta manera Rosa realiza sola  su negocio y le va muy bien, pues con su buen trato, todos los alumnos la estiman. Lo que más le gusta de su labor es conversar con las madres de los alumnos, de modo que les alerta del comportamiento de sus hijos, y  se siente muy feliz con su labor. Desde hace más de 15 años cocina sus papas, y se siente más que satisfecha por lo rentable que es el negocio. Para más adelante, piensa instalar una bodega en su casa y de ese modo ampliar su negocio.Es el 11avo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a posteriores créditos para continuar progresando.Rosa tiene planeado invertir  el dinero del préstamo , en la compra de juguetes y sandalias para vender ambulatoriamente, mientras los alumnos del colegio donde comercializa  están de vacaciones, y así quiere continuar adelante.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 44, is a very hard-working mother.  She lives with her husband and their two children in their own house.  The children are still in school.  

She makes stuffed potatoes (with ground meat), and she sells them at the door of a very popular school in her district.  Her business is seven blocks from her house.  She parboils the potatoes and then uniformly flattens them.  After that, she rolls it up with seasoning and the meat inside.  Her last step is to fry them in hot oil.

She then loads the potatoes on her large platter and sets herself up at the door of the school.  That is where the students buy her stuffed potatoes from her.  This is the way that Rosa works alone in her business, and it is going very well for her.  With her good service, all of the students value her.  What she likes the best about her work is talking with the students’ mothers.  She watches out for their children, and she is very happy with her work.

She has been cooking her potatoes for over 15 years.  She is more than satisfied with the profitability of the business.  Later, she plans to set up a grocery store in her house in order to expand her business.

This is her eleventh loan with MFP, and she pledges to make her payments punctually.  She wants to access future loans in order to continue progressing.  Rosa plans to use the loan to buy toys and sandals to sell in an itinerant manner.  She will do this when the students of the school where she sells are on vacation.   She wants to continue getting ahead that way.

loans.use: To buy toys and sandals to sell

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemí tiene 35 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos pequeños que estudian en el colegio. Noemí se dedica a coser blusas, camisas, faldas, pantalones y buzos,  es decir su especialidad es confeccionar uniformes y prendas deportivas para el colegio, mercadería que es ofrecida a sus amistades y profesores de los centros educativos que se encuentran cerca de su casa. De esta manera viene trabajando hace 6 años en esta labor, con la ayuda de su cuñada y hasta la de su esposo. Le gusta mucho la actividad que realiza, además lo haced desde la comodidad de su casa. Por ahora su meta es construir el segundo nivel de su casa, para que pueda acondicionar su taller de costura con más implementos.  Es el 11avo crédito con MFP, es una socia responsable y siempre preocupada por el bienestar del grupo comunal. De obtener el crédito que solicita, comprará tela en diversos diseños y modelos para elaborar más blusas, pantalones y faldas, ya que pronto se acerca la temporada escolar.
texts.en: Noemi is 35 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and her two small children who are in school. Noemi makes blouses, shirts, skirts, pants and sweatshirts. Her specialty is making uniforms and sportswear for schools. She offers her merchandise to her friends and to teachers at schools near her home. She has been working this way for six years with the help of her sister-in-law and sometimes her husband. She likes her job and likes that she can do it from the comfort of her home. Currently her goal is to add a second level to her home so that she can set up her sewing workshop with more machines. This is the 11th loan that she has obtained from field partner MFP. She is a responsible member and she always worries about the welfare of the community group. With the loan she is requesting she will buy fabric in different designs so that she can make more blouses, pants and skirts since the school season is approaching.

loans.use: Purchase different types of fabric.

loans.name: Hipólito

texts.es:
El señor Hipólito Quiñonez tiene 64 años de edad y vive con su señora Celina Quintana, quien tiene 67 años de edad, ambos de la ciudad de Caacupé, distante a unos 60 kilómetros de la ciudad capital (Asunción). Todos sus hijos ya son mayores de edad e independientes.
El Señor Hipólito vive en la compañía Candia en el barrio María Auxiliadora. En su domicilio cuentan con  plantaciones de frutas cítricas y se dedica a esto desde hace 15años.
Su local de ventas es el mercado.
Por más que el señor Hipólito y su señora trabajen mucho, poseen algunas necesidades que cubrir. Solicita el crédito para la compra de una plantación de mandarinas y pomelos.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya el apoyo obtenido para su actividad  y mediante ello ya podrá contar con más frutas para el momento de cosecha en este año.
texts.en:
Mr. Hipólito Quiñones, 64, lives with his wife, Celina Quintana, 67, in the city of Caacupé located about 60 kilometers from the capital city (Asunción).  
All of their children are independent adults.

Hipólito lives in the Candia company in María Auxiliadora neighborhood.  He has grown citrus fruits on his property for the last 15 years.  His place of sale is the market.

No matter how hard Hipólito and his wife work they still have some needs to cover.  He is asking for the loan to buy a mandarin orange and grapefruit orchard.

He is thankful to Fundación Paraguaya for the support it’s given for his activity because through it he will have more fruit to harvest this year.

loans.use: To buy a one hectare mandarin orange orchard.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura, tiene 29 años de edad, tiene un hijo y vive en la ciudad de Calca del departamento de Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica es la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Rosaura en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes, chanchos y gallinas. 

Rosaura pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rosaura is 29 years old and the mother of one child. She lives in Calca in the Peruvian department of Cusco. Her economic activity consists in breeding small animals like guinea pigs and hens. She has done that for four years and earned a good income thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Rosaura currently needs a loan to buy guinea pigs, pigs and hens.

Rosaura is a member of the communal bank "Señor de Huanca" of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided by this microfinance institution and promises to pay the installments on schedule.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs, pigs and hens

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras - Hernandarias Group

texts.es:
El comité se ha formado con la gestión de la señora Estela Maris B., quien vive en la zona Puerta de sol Hernandarias, en Ciudad del Este. Ella contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para conformar el grupo en la zona.
El comité se denomina Mujeres Luchadoras - Hernandarias. Está en el Primer Ciclo y está constituido por 10 integrantes; es un grupo que se destaca en el barrio por ser responsable y solidario.
Las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, trabajarán en conjunto en  la realización de actividades para recaudar fondos que puedan salvaguardar al comité en caso de necesidad, y pretenden terminar esta etapa con muy buen cumplimiento con la institución. Al adquirir el crédito se le abren muchas puertas a las señoras para el progreso de sus vidas.
Como por ejemplo, la señora Paola S. trabaja de mucama (empleada doméstica) y desea poder brindar a su familia un mejor vivir, pero para ello necesita de este crédito, así logra cubrir las necesidades más urgentes dentro de su grupo familiar y luego con ayuda de todos, iniciar un negocio de comestibles propio.
texts.en:
The committee was formed at the suggestion of Estela who lives in the Puerta de Sol Hernandarias zone of Ciudad del Este.  She contacted her neighbors and friends to put together a group in the zone.

The committee was named Mujeres Luchadoras (Fighting Women) - Hernandarias.  This is the 1st loan cycle and there are 10 members.  It is a group that stands out in the barrio for its solidarity and responsibility.  The members possess a great enterprising spirit, working together to realize activities to collect funds that the committee can safeguard in case of necessity, and attempting to close out this stage with very good cooperation with this institution.  Upon acquiring the loan, many doors will be opened for progress in the women's lives.

For example, Paola works as a domestic employee and wants to be able to offer her family a better life, but for this she needs a loan to cover the most urgent necessities of her family group and, then, with the help of all, to initiate a proper grocery business.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MERCHANDISE OF PRIMARY NECESSITY, INCLUDING FRUIT, VEGETABLES, AND GROCERIES IN GENERAL

loans.name: Nueva Ilusion Group

texts.en:
The communal bank "Nueva Ilusion" (New Illusion) at FINCA Peru has eleven members and is in their seventh loan cycle. Group members have businesses selling vegetables, alfalfa, fruits (like tuna, a local fruit), juices, and food and soup preparation. They are requesting a loan total of 5,950 Peruvian nuevos soles (PEN) .

Rosa is the president of the communal bank and has an artisan business. She is 50 years old, and has three children who are all grown. One is working and the younger two are completing their university studies. Rosa makes different types of artisanal goods such as traditional local dolls from Ayacucho, and bags and blankets maD. of handwoven wool. 

She will be using her loan of 300 PEN to purchase supplies for her business, such as wool. She sells the products in the local fairs of Huancayo, a neighboring province. She also receives special orders for her products. She has been a member on and off of FINCA Peru since 2000.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as wool

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 39 years old, married and has three children who range in age from 13 to 22. She also cares for a fourth child who is 22 years old. Jacqueline makes a living by running a well-organized business where she sells oil. She has been in this line of work for the last seven years, and runs her business from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day except Sunday. She has applied for a loan from Kiva to expand her business by buying more oil to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to expand her business and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more oil to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Stepen

texts.en: V. is currently in business selling alcohol. She is 38 years old, married, with six children and all of them go to school. V. borrowed a loan to stock more alcohol to sell. She hopes to  pay for her children in school with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Or

texts.en:
Or K. is 58 years old and owns a wooden kiosk in her village, Baray district of Kompong Tom province, where she sells food for people who need to have breakfast and lunch.  She typically makes around $2 of profit each day to meet what her family needs. 

Her husband is a rice farmer and he also hires his plowing machine to other farmers for a fee as well.  They are blessed with eight children, three are single, the other five are already married and two of whom are working as a primary teacher and in a garment factory. Currently, the plowing machine has often broken down while providing service.  Because of this problem, Or K. would like a loan to purchase a new plowing machine in order to continue providing the service to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase a new plowing machine in order to continue providing the plowing service.

loans.name: Nana Ekua

texts.en: Nana is married to a farmer and has three children. She has been selling provisions and food items such as garden eggs, okra, canned tomatoes, spices and other items in Abura for 15 years. Nana Ekua uses her income to assist her husband in providing for the family's basic needs. She will use this loan to purchase onions, pepper and other food items to sell.  She wishes to reinvest the new profit back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase onions, pepper and other food items to sell.

loans.name: Renelmo Manuel

texts.es:
Renelmo es un cliente de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia y tiene dos menores hijos a su cargo. Renelmo vive en el distrito San Pedro de Lloc perteneciente a la provincia de Pacasmayo – La Libertad. Esta es una comunidad pequeña y humilde en vías de desarrollo.

Renelmo se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de relojes, controles remotos, lentes de sol, entre otros, en un puesto ubicado en  las afueras del mercado de su comunidad. El negocio de Renelmo no cuenta con clientela establecida pero si con gran afluencia, estas ventas le permiten darle comodidades a sus hijos.

Renelmo solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de  2000 nuevos soles para comprar mercadería (relojes y controles remotos) para su negocio, así como para adquirir bienes personales que le son de suma necesidad.

Renelmo ya ha trabajado con nosotros y cuenta con un excelente récord de pagos.
texts.en:
Renelmo is a 39 year old client who lives in his own house and looks after his two young children. He lives in the district of San Pedro de Lloc, which is part of the Pacasmayo-La Libertad province. This is a small and humble community that is in the process of developing.
For the past 10 years, Renelmo has been selling watches, remote controls, sun glasses, and other items from a stall located on the outskirts of the community marketplace. The business does not have an established customer base, but there are many customers and the sales enable him to provide for his children.
Renelmo is requesting a $750 loan from Edpyme Alternativa to buy merchandise (watches and remote controls) for his business, and to buy some personal items that are of the utmost necessity. 
Renelmo has worked with us [Edypme] before and has an excellent repayment record.

loans.use: to buy watches and remote controls and for personal use

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - Pacasmayo - La Libertad

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Lun is a 51-year-old woman, married to Soem, age 47. They live in the Baray district. This couple earns a living by planting various crops on their own farm land. They have five children. Two of their children are working while the other three are still young and attend school. 

Lun will be using the loan to purchase rice seed and potato seed for planting.

loans.use: to purchase rice seed and potato seed for planting.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is married and has two children aged 2 and 9. He is a mechanic and services vehicles in the Karen area. Paul has been running this business for eight years. He intends to use this loan to buy more spare parts. 

Paul hopes to one day own a big "Duka" (shop) where customers can get any spare part they require. Paul describes himself as humble and hard-working.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts used to repair vehicles.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Verónica  tiene 31 años, radica desde hace 8 años en su localidad en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos  en casa de unos familiares. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a sembrar sobre su pequeña extensión que posee, así como en terrenos que arrienda. Paralelo a ello, cría cerdos y ovejas y que al cabo de un tiempo  son vendidos en la feria ganadera de su comunidad. De esta manera logra tener ingresos, además para minimizar los gastos de alimentación, prefiere sembrar alfalfa y pastos,  y del cual logra también venderlos generándose más ingresos. Todas estas actividades le permiten sostener su hogar, es por esta razón que  desea aumentar su capital de trabajo. Tiene mucho tiempo trabajando con MFP,  se animo a trabajar  de manera grupal por los ahorros programados que tiene y que es de mucha ayuda en su economía y es por esta razón que continua solicitando créditos. Con el dinero que solicita, será para sembrar pasto asimismo comprará ovejas y cerdos.
texts.en:
Verónica is 31 years old and has been a resident of her town for eight years. She lives with her husband and two children in the home of some relatives. For the past five years, Verónica has been farming on a small piece of land that she owns as well as on rented land. In addition, she raises pigs and sheep to sell at the livestock fair in her community. To generate income and minimize the cost of feeding her animals, Verónica grows alfalfa and grasses. She also sells these crops to generate a little more revenue. All of the activities enable her to maintain her household. For this reason, she wants to increase her operating capital.

Verónica has worked with MFP for a long time. She is excited about working with a group and the automatic savings plan, which has been a great help for her finances. For this reason, she plans to continue requesting loans. With the money she requested, Verónica will plant grass as well as buy sheep and pigs.

loans.use: to purchase grass seed, sheep, and pigs.

loans.name: Najat

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 45 years old, married and has seven children.

Najat is a midwife. She has owned a clinic since 2002. She has good experience in obstetrics and childbirth, a good reputation and she is well known in her area.

She is requesting a $2,800 loan to buy medical supplies, a split air conditioner and to make a ceiling for the clinic. She is optimistic about her business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring her positive growth.

loans.use: to buy medical supplies and a split air conditioner and to make a ceiling

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is a 27-year-old young woman. She is married and has one son. Her husband is a farmer. Jenny wants to start a grocery store to help her husband cover the family's expenses, since the income of the family isn't enough. Therefore, she needs to take a loan of PHP 10,000 to support the family.

Jenny will use the loan to buy some necessary goods such as boxes of milk, candies, snack foods and spices. This will enable Jenny to have her own project, which will add value to the family income and enhance their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy candies, milk, coffee, drinks, bread and canned goods.

loans.name: C9234 Duterimbere Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 20 years old. He is single, and he is also the leader of this group which is called "DUTERIMBERE" in the local language. He is the first person on the left side.  Emmanuel employs two people for help, and he has one year of experience in this business. He works from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day. 

Emmanuel and his group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses. Once their businesses are expanded, they hope to satisfy their customers, and they will be able to reinvest in their businesses, and to save for the future.

loans.use: To increase his business by buying more beans, soap, sugar, rice, and so on to sell.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr:
Adjovi est une femme âgée de 46 ans. Elle est mariée à un retraité. Elle a 6 enfants.
Adjovi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2011. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation général (lessives, laits, pates alimentaires) à toutes les personnes. Elle achète les produits au grand marché de Lomé.  Elle travaille avec 2 personnes. 
Adjovi a requis son premier crédit  à  WAGES afin d’acheter et vendre les lessives, les pates alimentaires, les laits. Elle veut étendre son activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Adjovi voudrait agrandir son marché. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit  avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Adjovi, age 46, is married to a retiree and has six children. She's been working as a salesperson since 2011. She sells general food products (laundry detergent, milk, pasta) to anyone. She gets her supplies at the Grand Market in Lomé, and works with two persons.

Adjovi is seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy and sell laundry detergent, pasta and milk. In the forthcoming years, she would like to expand her business and her shop. She says that her profits will help to make her family happy.

loans.use: to buy laundry detergents, pasta, and dairy products

loans.name: Chay

texts.en:
Chay and his wife, Chanthy, live along National Road No.1, approximately 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1993 and have five daughters.  

Chay and his wife are rice and vegetables farmers. He is applying for his second Kiva loan of 1,000 USD to make a new stairway for his house because it’s old and breaks. He will also use part of the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

In the photo are Chay and his wife and their young daughter.

loans.use: To make a new stairway for his house and to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loans.name: Kanyshai's Group

texts.en:
Kanyshai is the leader of this group. She is 53 and, unfortunately, a widow. She has raised two sons and two daughters. The daughters are married and live separately with their families. The older son works in Russia, and the second son works as a security guard. Kanyshai works at school; she also breeds livestock. She keeps a cow and six goats. She resells livestock after fattening, which earns her an additional 2,000 KGS per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase five goats to increase the number of livestock she keeps. In the future Kanyshai wants to see her sons get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan.
