Today she dedicates her time strengthening her business and therefore she has approached Ceprodel to be the beneficiary of a loan and in this way acquire the basic grains to continue offering them in her establishment.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains to sell in her store

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Monsieur A. Kodjo a commencé très tôt le commerce de vente de bijoux garanties, il est très dynamique et très travailleur, beaucoup de ses clientes l’apprécient car il est très rare de voir les hommes exercer ce commerce,il fait parfois son commerce de façon ambulante.Il s’approvisionne au BENIN voisin et en Côte d’ivoire. Sa clientèle étant grandissante, il doit par conséquent agrandir son stock pour cela il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour se réapprovisionner en bijoux garanties. N’étant pas marié, son statut de célibataire lui permet de bien gérer son activité
texts.en:
Mr. Kodjo A. started his business very early on. It consists in selling jewelry, which he sometimes does as an ambulant salesman. Mr. A. is very energetic and hard-working, and many female customers appreciate him because it is uncommon to find a men doing this sort of business. He gets his supplies in Benin and in Côte d'Ivoire. He needs to bolster his stock since his customers are increasing. This is why he's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to get new supplies of necklaces. Being unmarried, he is able to manage his business in a good manner.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell jewelry

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina tiene 46 años, vive con sus hijas mayores. Hace 5 años que se dedica a vender dulces y frutas en una esquina cerca de su casa, debido a no contar con un puesto fijo ha estado rotando constantemente su lugar de ventas. Pero ahora se ha instalado en un lugar cercano a un centro educativo, donde sus principales clientes son los escolares, y las personas que transitan por esa calle. Gracias a la constancia, y ha saber administrar sus ganancias, en la actualidad maneja el dinero suficiente para sostener sus gastos. Además es el apoyo de sus hijas en sus necesidades económicas, para un futuro próximo está planeando implementar su negocio con otros productos y poder tener un lugar fijo para su negocio. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, es una de las socias más activas de su banco comunal y esto le permite ser emprendedora para su desarrollo personal y el de los demás integrantes.  El dinero que viene solicitando es para la compra de frutas, gaseosas y dulces, con esto aumentará su capital y sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Sabina is 46 years old and lives with her grown daughters. For 5 years she has been selling sweets and fruits in a corner near her house. Since she doesn't have a permanent place, she has moved where she does her sales. Now, however, she has settled in a place near an education center, where her main customers are the students and the people who are walking down the street. Thanks to her steadfastness, and her knowledge of administrating earnings, now she handles money well enough to support her expenses. Moreover, this is possible from the support of her daughters in her economic needs. In the future she plans to implement other products in her business and have a permanent place for the business. This is her second loan with MFP. She is one of the most active members in her community bank and this allows her to be enterprising in her own development and that of others. The money of the requested loan is to buy fruits, sodas and sweets, with this she will increase her capital and earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing of inventory

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther es una señora de 50 años, está casada, tiene 6 hijos, 5 de ellos migraron a la capital, y  ahora viven con el último en su casa, quien la apoya en todos los trabajos que realiza. Desde niña se ha dedicado a las labores agrícolas y está muy contenta con los trabajos que realiza, además que cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, por lo que los trabajos de la chacra no los siente tan pesados. Una vez que han cosechado sus productos, los dos son los encargados de comercializarlos en el mercado de la ciudad  de Tarma. Para ellos, se preparan desde las 11.00pm hasta la 1.00am poniendo su carga en un camión, y eso de 4.00am ya están en el mercado. La última vez se dieron con la sorpresa de que el saco de la papa había bajado y sus ventas no les resultaran muy rentables. Esther viene trabajando su 4to crédito consecutivo con MFP y en todo este tiempo ha sido responsable, así como los demás integrantes de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para que realice el barbecho (preparar la tierra para la siembra) de sus chacras temporales, asimismo comprará fertilizantes químicos para abonar.
texts.en:
Esther is a 50 year old woman who is married and has 6 children. Five of her children have moved to the capital. She and her husband live with the youngest, who supports them in all of the work they do. Since she was a child she has done agricultural work and is very happy with the work she does. She also has the support of her husband, which makes the farm work feel less burdensome. Once Esther and her husband have harvested their crops, they sell them in the market in the city of Tarma. To do this, they work from 11pm until 1am loading their products onto a truck, and at 4am they are in the market. The last time, they were surprised by a drop in the price of a sack of potatoes, and their sales were not very profitable. Esther has taken out 4 consecutive loans with MFP and during this entire time she has been responsible, like the other members of her communal bank. The money that she is requesting is to prepare the fallow land for planting on her seasonal plots, and to purchase chemical fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Prepare her land and purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Shamshad Amjad Masih Group

texts.en:
Shamshad Baji is A. M.'s wife. They live in a historical place named Yadgar in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a blacksmith and makes iron rods on order. Shamshad Baji is a very supportive lady. She always encourages her husband whether his business goes well or not. Her support gives him strength to move forward. She is applying for a loan to buy iron to make iron rods to complete the orders of his customers. 
Razia Baji is requesting a loan to buy electrical supplies like wires, switchboards and switches for her electrical supplies business. 
Tahira Parveen Baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. The picture is of Tahira Baji's grocery shop. 
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy iron for making iron rods

loans.name: Trần Thị

texts.en:
Hòa Tràn Thị (1815071321) is a 32-year-old female living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has three school-aged children.

Hòa owns and operates a manufacturing business, primarily manufacturing and selling bamboo products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2007, Hòa joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in renovating her business.

Hòa is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. The loan will be her 3rd from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Punipuao

texts.en: Punipuao M., 28, is married with 2 children.  She has 1 year of experience in the vegetable garden business.  She sells to the public 6 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD.  Punipuao expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).  SPBD loans are Punipuao’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase weedkiller,spade,axe,rakes,chemicals.

loans.name: Frejala

texts.en: Frejala M. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol and is requesting a loan to purchase more sugar and yeast for brewing. Frejala is 41 years old and is widowed. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Frejala hopes to be able to buy a plot and rent it out. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar and yeast for brewing

loans.name: Leonia

texts.en:
Leonia L. is a 54-year-old woman living in the town of Tiavea 2.  She is married and has one adult child.  To make a living, Leonia owns & operates a business raising cattle for sale.  Leonia has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 2000 WST a month from these activities.

In 2007, Leonia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Leonia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2250 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional animals.  Leonia is now requesting a new loan of 2200 WST, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Leonia from SPBD.  Leonia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie S. is from the village of Westfield, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 31 years old. Margie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Margie owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling electronic cellphone loads in the local community. Margie has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Margie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Margie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Westfield, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Orienta

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo, quien trabaja en una empresa petrolera, tienen 6 hijos varones, 4 de ellos ya son mayores de edad y trabajan independientemente, y los dos últimos aun son estudiantes. Desde hace 8 años tiene un pequeño puesto en un mercado de su localidad donde vende ropa y gracias a todos estos años ya cuenta con una clientela regular y puede obtener ganancias diarias. Adicionalmente; hace 3 años compró un motocarro y posteriormente otro, hace un año, con estos vehículos trabajan dos de sus hijos realizando transporte de pasajeros, es así que cada día entregan las ganancias obtenidas a Luz para que ella las administre. 
Este es su 8vo crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que todos sus compañeros son muy responsables y trabajadores. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más ropa en un monto aproximado de 2000 soles, con el resto planea adquirir repuestos para mandar a reparar sus motocarros.
texts.en:
Luz, 47, lives with her husband who works for an oil business. She has six sons. Four of them are adults who work independently, and the last two are students. For eight years she has had a small stall in her regional market where she sells clothes. Thanks to all of these years, she has regular customers and she can get daily income. Also, three years ago she bought a “motocarro” (a three wheeled motorized cart). A year later she bought another one. Two of her sons work with these vehicles transporting passengers. Every day they give their earnings to Luz to manage. This is her eighth loan with MFP. What she likes about working with her communal bank is that all of her colleagues are very responsible and hard working. She will use the money she is asking for to buy more clothes for approximately 2,000 PEN. With the rest she plans to get spare parts to have her motocarros repaired.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is a vegetable vendor in the village of Old Centro, San Mateo, Isabela. She is blessed with four children whom she supports with her daily income from vegetable selling. Her eldest child is Arthur, a 27-year-old high school graduate; then there is Khim, a 21-year-old college graduate; Alily, a 19-year-old who has just finished her two-year course; and Cris, an 18-year-old criminology student.

Lily wants her children to have a good future and she supports them in their dreams and ambitions. She believes that through her planting and selling of different vegetables, she can enable them to be what they want to be. In this regard, she would like to ask for financial support of 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders to buy more kinds of vegetables to sell in the villages and also to maintain her vegetable garden from which she gets some of her products.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell and to maintain her vegetable garden

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina P. is 7 years older than her husband, Benedicto P., who is now 50 years old. Their children are: Marisol, age 15 and Mary Joy, age 13, both still studying; Elmer, age 32, now married; Melvin, age 30, also married; and Mary Ann, age 22, still single.

Celerina’s husband has been working continuously as a security guard in Taytay Rizal for fifteen years now and this was the one source of their income. But, because they have more expenses in their house plus the expenses of two children in school, Celerina had to think of another way to augment her husband’s insufficient salary.

The solution that Celerina thought of is to start a business that fits their place to produce an extra income. But one of her dilemmas in starting the business was a lack of capital for it. Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) is the one who solved her dilemma.

Celerina joined ASHI in 2004 and the loan that she received from the institution was used as capital to start the business that she thought of, which is food preparation. Now she wants to again use a loan to improve her business. She wants to buy some necessary things needed in her business like a different bowl where the menu is placed. She also wants to diversify her menu for a much bigger income.

Celerina does everything to make her business grow more. She exerts more effort with the help of her daughter, Mary Ann. Celerina is the one who will buy the ingredients in the afternoon and cook them the next morning and Mary Ann will sell the food. Celerina really does everything to make her business grow in order for her children, and also her grandchildren, to experience a better life.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her food preparation business

loans.name: Hikmat

texts.en: Hikmat is single and lives in the Fuzuli region. He was born in 1984. This young man has been in this business for four years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy foodstuffs to improve his general store.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Mrs. Phea Roeun Tey Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phea Roeun T. is the mother of two young children and the president of her village bank. The bank has nine members, all of whom live in Prek Ruesse Village in Kandal Province. 

Mrs. Phea Roeun T. is a farmer who grows rice. Her husband, Mr. K. Chab, is fisherman. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she is requesting a loan to buy more fishing nets for her husband's fishing business. She will use the rest of the loan to fix her house. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more fishing nets and fix her house

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina, engaged to Lorenzo, has six children: Darwin, 27 years old, Efren, 26, George, 25, Lorenzo Jr., 22, Lorena, 21, and Kerovin, 17. Most of Rufina's children have already obtained college-level education. 
Rufina makes a living for her family by selling Ready To Wear clothes (RTWs) and fruit in the local community. Her fiancé Lorenzo is a farmer, cultivating and tilling rice, and through his work earns the main share of the family's income. Rufina currently needs additional funds (approximately PHP 12,000) to be able to develop her sales business. Specifically, she will use the money to buy additional RTWs to respond to the many orders.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy W. has been selling vegetables and fruit to residents at Kiganjo for the past three years. Her business challenges are the lack of proper storage to store perishable goods and lack of funds to restock vegetables for selling.

She will use the loan proceeds of KES20,000 to buy beans, maize and to add to her stock of vegetables and fruit. Her goal in life is to become a wholesaler. Mercy is single and has two daughters. She describes herself as hard working, caring and respectable.

loans.use: To buy cabbages, maize and beans.

loans.name: Janneth Marlene

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Ahorro está formado por un grupo de mujeres alegres, carismáticas y  triunfadoras que  buscan la manera de salir adelante siempre con una sonrisa y siendo visionarias de un mejor futuro para ellas y su familia saliendo avante    ante las dificultades que la vida les presenta en su día a día, todas  viven en  la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca,  localidad que se caracteriza  por ser la tercera ciudad más importante del Ecuador, proclamada también como Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad por su belleza natural, la incomparable  arquitectura de  su centro histórico.


La señora  Janneth Narváez   tiene 20 años de edad, vive en el sector San Pedro el Cebollar en unión libre con su pareja, tiene cinco meses de gestación  y aun no sabe el sexo de su bebe, su esposo trabaja como vendedor ambulante de menaje de cocina y más artículos para el hogar, no tienen casa propia y se encuentran viviendo en casa de su mamá compartiendo los gastos del hogar con ella.

Janneth trabaja como vendedora ambulante de productos de limpieza y aseo personal: detergente, jabón, papel, etc., su horario de trabajo es de 7 a.m. a  6 p.m. recorriendo todos los mercados y plazas de la ciudad, nuestra socia lleva un año en ésta actividad y  nos comenta que el negocio se encuentra bajo por esta temporada  pero espera que pronto mejore.

Lleva ocho ciclos en su bankito y los préstamos recibidos le han servido para iniciar con su negocio, ahora con el nuevo crédito solicitado  va a comprar más jabón, detergentes, papel higiénico, pasta dental y más productos de limpieza y aseo personal para surtir mejor su negocio 

Su meta es salir adelante junto a su hijo y  esposo y cuidar de su madre hasta el último día que Dios le tenga a su lado.
texts.en:
The community bank "El Ahorro" is set up by a group of gay, charismatic, and triumphant ladies who are seeking the way to get ahead always with a smile. They are visionaries of a better future for themselves as well as for their families, as they will move ahead in spite of the difficulties presented daily by life. They all live in the town of Cuenca, the third most important town of Ecuador as well as a Cultural Heritage of Humanity because of its natural beauty and the incomparable architecture of its historic center.

Mrs. Janneth Narváez is 20 years old, she lives in the sector San Pedro el Cebollar with her significant other, she is 5 months pregnant and does not know the gender of her baby. Her husband works as a street vendor of kitchenware and home articles. They do not own a house and are living with her mother sharing the costs of living.

Janneth works as a street vendor selling cleaning products such as: detergent, soap, paper, etc. She works from 7 am to 6 pm at the different markets and plazas of the town. Our partner has done this for a year and she tells us that business is slow for this season but hopes it will improve.

She has had eight loans with the bank and the loans have helped her set up her business. Now with the new loan she will buy soap, detergents, toilet paper, tooth paste, and more products for cleaning and personal grooming. It is her goal to get ahead together with her child and husband, and to take care of her mother until her last day alive when God will take her to his side.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soap, detergent, toilet paper, tooth paste, etc.

loans.name: Sokhy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhy S. lives in Cheav Bdei Khang Kaeut village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 2.5-hectare field where she cultivates rice. On this plantation, she now faces some problems because her field has infertile soil and is far from the irrigation system. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and a water machine, with the remainder of the loan to be used for buying pesticides to kill insects. 

Her husband, Mr. Channa Orm, is a farmer and is on the left of the photo. Aside from working as a farmer, he is also a fisherman who earns a small income to support his family. Mrs. Sokhy S. is the mother of two children who are both students at the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, a water machine and pesticides to kill insects.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema A. is an entrepreneurial woman, who is married with three school-aged children. She runs a food stuffs shop at Tungi Kigamboni in Dar es Salaam. She sells a variety of food stuff at her shop. She purchases the goods direct from the wholesalers and retail shops at Ferry and Kariakoo city market shopping center. She sells maize flour, wheat flour, beans, sugar, ground nuts, rice and cashew nuts. She meets her family's daily demand from the business income. She plans to open another shop for business diversification once she gets enough funds. She needs a loan to boost her business.

loans.use: To buy more business goods.

loans.name: Olga Janneth

texts.es:
Olga Janneth D.  es socia activa del banco comunal Mujer y Fortaleza  hace seis ciclos gracias a su  cuñada que la incentivó a formar parte de este gran grupo de mujeres formado en la parroquia Turi al sureste de la ciudad de Cuenca, sector conocido como el balcón de la ciudad es muy turístico por la belleza natural del campo, la gastronomía y la amabilidad de su gente, la mayor parte de su población  se dedica a la agricultura y también a otras  actividades que les permiten establecerse económicamente para así poder salir adelante.

Olga es una  mujer de 25 años está felizmente casada su esposo es guardia de seguridad de un local  comercial y tiene dos hijos de 8 y 9 años, es  muy  alegre y siempre ve lo positivo de cada día y así triunfar en la vida, es costurera de profesión pues estudio  por tres  años en una academia, al momento se dedica a la confección y venta de blusas lleva dos años en esta actividad en su taller ubicado en su  casa, nos comenta que  los créditos le han beneficiado para comenzar con su propio negocio.

Además manifiesta que no tiene casa propia y vive en casa de sus padres compartiendo con ellos los gastos, y  con el dinero que reciba del préstamo solicitado va a comprar telas, hilos, cierres, botones y más materiales para la confección de sus blusas para incrementar su taller de costura que es su gran sueño.
texts.en:
Olga Janneth D. has been an active member of the community bank Mujer y Fortaleza ("Woman and Strength") for six loan cycles thanks to her mother-in-law, who motivated her to become part of this great group of women. Mujer y Fortaleza is based in the parish of Turi, which is southeast of the city of Cuenca. Turi is known as the city's balcony. It is a very touristic area because of the countryside's natural beauty, the gastronomy, and the good-hearted nature of its people. The majority of Turi's population works in agriculture. People also work in other activities that allow them to establish themselves economically in order to move forward in life. Olga is a 25 year-old woman happily married to her husband, who is a security guard in a local store. She has two children who are 8 and 9 years sold. She is very happy and always looks at the positive of every day, and because of this triumphs in live. She works as a seamstress and studied for three years in an academy to do this. Currently she works making and selling blouses. She has spent two years doing this from the workshop located in her house. She tells us that the loans have helped her begin her own business. Furthermore, she expresses that she does not have her own house, so she lives in her parents' house and shares household costs with them. With the money she receives from the requested loan she will buy fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, and other materials needed to make blouses in order to build her business, which is his her big dream.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, and other materials needed to make blouses

loans.name: Claricsa Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Claricsa del Socorro L., de 41 años de edad vive en el Barrio el Eden es madre soltera de 7 hijos dentro de los cuales 2 son mayores de edad y sobreviven de manera independiente, los demas estudian la secundaria y la primaria y apoyan a los trabajos de la agricultura. 

La familia se dedica a los trabajos de la agricultura desde  hace 30 años, y comenzaron gracias al apoyo económico del padre y dentro de los principales problemas estan la afectación de las tierras por las plagas, ellos por esta razon solicitan de un prestamo para la compra de fertilizantes, esto le ayudara de sobremanera a las tierras de la señora Claricsa y les apoyara económicamente al producirse un producto de calidad, ellos son una familia muy humilde que se apoyan entre todos y esperan que se les brinde un apoyo para emprenderse a nuevos proyectos de vida.
texts.en:
Señora Claricsa del Socorro L., age 41, lives in the Eden neighborhood. She is a single mother of 7 children. Two of these are older and live independently. The rest are in secondary and primary school. She supports them through agricultural work.

The family has been engaged in agriculture for 30 years. They began thanks to the financial support of her father. Among her principal problems is the susceptibility of her fields to diseases. It is for this reason that she is applying for a loan for the purchase of fertilizers. This will be exceedingly helpful to Señora Claricsa’s fields and will provide economic support to her family by producing high quality crops. They are a very humble family that supports one another and they hope that this offers them support for pursuing new opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for the maintenance of her crops.

loans.name: Candida's Group

texts.en:
Candida G. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Tangub City. She is 60 years old. Candida is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Candida is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Candida owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Candida has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Candida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Candida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Candida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
69-year-old Francisca manages a sari-sari (convenience) store in her house in Trinidad, Bohol. Now a widow, she is left with seven children to take care of. She says that she hopes for her store to prosper so that she would be able to provide for her family. She still sends some of her children to school. She dreams for them to finish college and have a bright future.

Francisca sought the help of an MFI to support her business. She joined CEVI and asks for a loan of PHP 10,000, which she will use to acquire supplies for her store.

loans.use: Store supplies

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia E. is a single parent with one child. She has received junior high education. She bakes bread to sell at Akotokyire and uses her income to provide a meaningful education for her child.

Emilia will use the loan to purchase more flour and other ingredients to bake bread for sale. With the new profits from her extended business, she plans to save to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more flour and other ingredients

loans.name: Song

texts.en: Mr. Song S. is a 25-year-old married man with a child who is too young to study or work. They all live in Pun Phnum village in Takeo province. Mr. Song S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Sokha Nak, is a seamstress in a garment factory where she receives a small salary to support her family. In order to increase his income to improve his family's living conditions, Mr. Song S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina I. is from the village of District 2. in Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 48 years old. Josefina is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Josefina sells seafood, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Josefina has been engaged in her business for over 22 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Josefina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be Josefina's fifth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Randy

texts.en:
Randy A., age 38 and married, is from the village of Parog-Parog, Solana, Cagayan. To make a living, Randy raises crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Randy has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Randy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. He planned to help improve his living situation and increase his ability to engage in business activities. Randy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. Randy is now requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Randy from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase rice-field fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwainaidi is married with one girl who goes to school. Her spouse is a mechanic by profession and he contributes to the family's needs. She has been selling soft drinks and boiled potatoes for the last year. She sells charcoal as her other source of livelihood.

With the 25,000 Kenyan shillings loan, she wants to purchase a portable cooler box to be used for supplying soft drinks to schoolchildren and neighbors. She also sells at a shop and from home.

Mwanaidi explains that seasonality is her major challenge, as during cold weather there is no demand for soft drinks compared to hot weather. She hopes to operate a retail shop in future. 

With the organization's vision of empowering rural entrepreneurs through accessibility of financial services, she decided to join Yehu to get a loan to improve her living standards. She owns a home  with electricity and piped water. She cites electricity and school fees as her greatest monthly expenses.

loans.use: To buy a cooler box to enable her to serve a wider market

loans.name: Maryorie Jissela

texts.es:
Maryorie Jissela V. V. tiene 19 años.  Es soltera y vive con sus padres, en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Maryorie es una socia de la ventanilla rural Patrón San Juan, que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda. Son 16 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a cultivos de papas y maíz. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Maryorie trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando papas. También tiene una tienda donde vende colas y salchipapas (plato típico con salchichas y papas). Realiza sus compras cada semana el lunes y sus ventas el viernes y sábado en Guaranda.

Solicita el préstamo para aumentar su negocio de salchipapas y poner leche y otros productos. Piensa que el crédito le ayudara para vender más y aumentar su negocio. Su sueño es tener una casa y un terreno. 
Le gusta ver televisión e ir a pasear en Guaranda.
texts.en:
Maryorie Jissela V. V. is a 19-year-old single woman who lives with her parents in the Guaranda canton of the Bolívar province.

Maryorie is a member of the Patrón San Juan rural microfinance institute, located a half an hour from Guaranda. There is a total of 16 members in the group, the majority of whom cultivate corn and potatoes. This is their first loan from the San José cooperative.

Maryorie grows potatoes for a living. She also has a shop in which she sells soda pop and salchipapas (South American street food made with pan-fried sausages and fries). She makes her purchases every Monday and sells her products on Fridays and Saturdays in Guaranda.

She is requesting this loan in order to expand her salchipapa business, as well as to offer milk and other products. She thinks that this loan will help her boost sales and increase business. Her dream is to own a home and a plot of land.

She likes to watch television and to go out in Guaranda.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand street food business and sell milk and other products

loans.name: Serigne Barra Sope Mohamed Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité SERIGNE BARRA SOPE MOHAMED est créé le 30 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 21 femmes issues du même village. Les membres se sont regroupés par voisinage et par affinité.

Madame Anta F., debout à l'extrême droite de la photo et mise en médaillon en haut à gauche, est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 56ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants et a la charge de sa petite fille. 

Elle faisait la transformation et vente d'huile d'arachide. Avec son nouveau elle va changer d'activité en faisant de l'embouche bovine.

Elle va acheter une paire de moutons qu'elle va emboucher pendant 5 moins et les revendre dans les marchés de sa localité.

Son objectif est de constituer un bon capital épargne et de participer à la prise en charge familiale par la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Serigne Barra Sope Mohamed was established on December 30, 2009. It is composed of 21 women from the same village. The members are grouped by community and by affinity. Ms. Anta F. (standing at the far right in the photo and appearing in the inserted portrait at the upper left) is the leaD. of the solidarity group. She is 56 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She also has responsibility for her granddaughter. Ms. F. makes peanut oil and sells it. With her new loan, she is going to switch to another business, the fattening of livestock. She is going to buy a pair of sheep, which she will fatten for five months and then sell at the markets in her town. Her goal is to save up enough capital and to help support her family by way of food and health care.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying two sheep

loans.name: Vuy

texts.en:
Mrs. Vuy T. (pictured here) and her husband, Mr. Sophy An, 46, have been married since 1982. They have six children: one son and five daughters. Two of them married and live in separate homes, one is a garment-factory worker and the other three are in school.
 
Vuy has been a weaver since she was 17 years old, while her husband has been a wooden-house builder since 1979. She wants to supplement with a new business by purchasing finished silk fabric from fellow villagers for resale. But she does not have capital; hence, she is requesting her second loan of $1,100 to launch the business.

loans.use: To buy cotton and silk fabric for resale

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina D. is from the village of Cabisera 8. She is 39 years old. Saturnina is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Saturnina owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Saturnina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Saturnina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Saturnina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Saturnina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Saturnina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Eymin Johilia

texts.es: La Señora Eymin Johila  tiene su negocio que es la venta de cosméticos, ella tiene 30 años y es casada. Ella realiza sus actividades diarias del hogar antes de salir a vender a ofrecer sus diferentes productos, Eymin trabaja desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 8 la noche por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar sus ingresos. Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar polvos, cremas, perfumes y tratamientos. Por lo que se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Eymin Johila has a cosmetics sales business. She is 30 years old and married. She completes the daily household chores before leaving to sell her different products. Eymin works from 8am – 8pm, as she is always looking for a way to improve her earnings. She is requesting the loan to purchase powders, creams, perfumes and treatments. She promises to make her payments according to the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yehia

texts.en: Yehia is 38 years old, married and the father of five children. He lives in Chtoura. Since 1997 Yehia has worked as a pick-up driver selling fruits and vegetables all over his neighborhood and in nearby villages. Yehia is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to do some necessary maintenance work on his pick-up in addition to paying for some necessary things he needs. His reputation makes him strong in his locality and market. He hopes to open a wholesale grocery store in the future.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance on his pick-up

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria G. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 62 years old, widowed and has 3 adult-aged children. Gloria owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily snacks and other delicacies, in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2002, Gloria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. This will be the 13th loan taken out by Gloria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital

loans.name: Clovis

texts.en: Clovis is a dealer in local brew and cattle. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda with his wife and five children aged 16, 14, 12, 8 and 4 years old. He looks after a family of 11 people in a house he constructed for the family. He has been into the cattle business for most of his life since childhood he says. This is the fifth loan for Clovis from HOFOKAM and he intends to use the loan proceeds to buy cattle and local brew for selling at a margin.

loans.use: To buy cattle and local brew for selling at a margin

loans.name: Molleccato Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal "MOLLECCATO"; la socia vive en el distrito de Urcos y provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Paulino: ella tiene 35 años de edad ella es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos;  la socia se dedica a la venta de comidas caseras en la plaza central de Urcos, ella tiene un stand de venta de comidas típicas de la zona. Ella tiene este negocio desde el año 2006, la socia desea incrementar sus ventas para lo cual ella solicita capital para comprar los insumos y también platos y cubiertos para su negocio ambulatorio. La socia solicita le préstamo para comprar insumos y cubiertos para su negocio.

Los socios se dedican a la crianza de animales menores, la venta de comida, al transporte (triciclos) llevar carga pesada a los mercados y otros lugares; a la venta de productos secos, obrero.
La socia agradece el préstamo que se le otorgará y se compromete a seguir trabajando con mucho ahincó para cumplir con los pagos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
This partner is s member of the Molleccato community bank. She  lives in the Urcos district in the Quispicanchis province, deparment of Cusco. The partner is 35 year old Paulina, who is in a common-law marriage and has 3 children. She makes a living selling home-made food in the central plaza of Urcos, where she has a stand selling typical food. She has had this business since 2006 and wishes to increase her sales. To that end she requests a loan to buy ingredients as well as plates and silverware for her business. 

The other partners make a living by raising small animals, selling food, transportation (tricycle), carrying heavy cargo to other places and markets, selling dry goods, and as a general laborers. This partners is thankful for the loan and is committed to keep working hard to makes her payments and improve her business.

loans.use: This partner requests a loan to buy ingredients and silverware for her business

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty S. is currently in the business of selling maize flour and cassava tubers at the market, and is requesting a loan to stock bags of beans and rice to sell. Betty is 23 years old and is married to a businessman. She has 2 children and only 1 child goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: Stock bags of beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy K. is a 28 year-old married woman with three children. She operates a green grocery which has been in existence for the past two years now. The business is situated at the airport in Malindi town. 

Nancy was introduced to KADET LIMITED by another client of the company, and this will be her third loan from the company. The loan is KES 40,000, and she plans to use it to add stock to her grocery as well as repair the business structure. 

Nancy wishes to use the anticipated profit from the business to continue expanding the business and purchase more stock. Her dream is to see her family healthy and make sure her children are well-educated.

loans.use: to sustain and grow the client's grocery business

loans.name: Sarvinaz

texts.ru:
Sarvinaz H. 58 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 3 detey kotoriye uchatsya v universitete. Ona yavlyayestay IDP personom , pereselenec iz Zengilan i seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste s semyoy.

Servinaz seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi uvelichit pomesheniye dlya toqo chtobi pomestit bolshe novix tovarov. Ona uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji produktov.
texts.en:
Sarvinaz H. is 58 years old. She is married and has three children who go to the university.  She is an internally displaced person and has been relocated from Zengilan and now lives in the Absheron region together with her family.  

Sarvinaz needs 2000 AZN to expand the space of her store to house more new merchandise.  She has been in the business of selling groceries for seven years.

loans.use: To expand the store space

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.en:
Sylvie is 30 years old and married with two children who are 4 and 7 years old. She also takes care of two relatives who are 11 and 14 years old.  Sylvie is a self-employed businesswoman selling a variety of goods, as her photo indicates. Those goods include water and juice. Her shop is open from 6am to 6pm every day and she has had this business for three years.

Sylvie has now requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her shop by purchasing a large quantity of water and juice.  With this large quantity, she will also start wholesaling. In doing so, she hopes to earn more profits, which will allow her to renovate her house, continue to pay school fees for her two relatives and build a secure future for her two children.

loans.use: To purchase a large stock of water and juice

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia lives in Jaranwala which is a small city of Punjab Pakistan which is famous for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a 2 room brick house with her family. 

She is married to M. M. who is 43 years old and is a daily wage labor. 

Razia has given birth to 2 sons and 4 daughters. She couldn’t provide them education facilities due to poor financial conditions. Her eldest son operates a donkey cart and offers loading services to his clients. He contributes the family financially through the earning. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who also wants to buy a donkey cart and start loading business because his profession doesn’t return with good income and in result his family suffers from financial aspect.  

Razia is hopeful that through the loan investment her husband will be able to approach many clients and makes better profits from his new business. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan year, she has established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Razia”.

loans.use: To buy a donkey cart for starting a loading business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita R. N. y su esposo desde hace 23 años se dedican al negocio sobre ruedas, en este momento su mayor afición es a la venta de ropa usada, zapatos y accesorios para el hogar. Este negocio es su única fuente de ingresos es por ello que desean invertir mas en el para seguir prosperando. Margarita se ven en la necesidad de pedir un préstamo para comprar ropa de temporada ya que en Diciembre tuvo muchas ventas.
texts.en: For the past 23 years, Margarita R. N. and her husband have had a business on wheels.  Right now, their main passion is selling used clothes, shoes and household products.  This business is their only source of income and they would like to invest in it so that it continues to prosper.  Margarita needs to request a loan so that she can buy seasonal clothing since she made a lot of sales in December.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Martha Mariela

texts.es:
Martha de 34 años, es originaria de Pueblo Nuevo municipio  de Estelí, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, estudio secretariado ejecutivo, tiene una mini tienda donde vende ropa y cosméticos la cual  tiene 7 años de funcionar. Comenzó a trabajar en este negocio con ayuda de su  esposo que trabaja como conductor de autobuses públicos. Al principio vendía  mercadería ambulante de casa en casa con el tiempo, hizo un préstamo y logro poner su mini tienda la cual tiene dentro de su propia casa, solamente ha tenido este negocio, la experiencia de saber este negocio la heredo de sus padres quienes han tenido este tipo de negocios y le han enseñado a ella como administrarlo bien. 
El crédito lo solicita para comprar productos nuevos como repuestos de vehículos y hacer mejoras a su vivienda. Este crédito le ayudara a mejorar y acondicionar mejor su negocio y vivienda, para poder ofrecer mejores  productos atraer mas clientes y darles un techo digno donde vivan sus hijos.
Tiene como planes ampliar sus negocio donde también pueda vender zapatos al por mayor, comprar vitrinas para mantenerlas surtida de nuevos productos.
texts.en:
Martha is 34 years old and from Pueblo Nuevo, in the town of Estelí.  She is married and has 3 children.  Martha studied to be a business secretary.  She owns a small store where she sells clothes and cosmetics.  She has owned her business for 7 years.  Martha started working in this business with the help of her husband who works as a bus driver.  At first, she sold her merchandise door to door but she took a loan and managed to set up a small store in her own home.  This is the only business she has owned.  She inherited the experience she needed for this business from her parents who also owned this type of business and they taught her to run it well. 

Martha is requesting this loan to buy new products such as vehicle spare parts and to make some improvements to her home.  This loan will help her to improve and better adapt her home and business so that she can offer better products, attract more customers and provide her children with a decent home in which to live.  Her plans are to expand her business so that she can also sell shoes wholesale, to buy display cases and to keep her store stocked with new products.

loans.use: To buy new products such as vehicle spare parts and to make improvements to her home

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en: Vicenta is a 51-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a restaurant. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her restaurant business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 12,000. Vicenta is borrowing PHP 24,500 to purchase raw materials. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 24,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Vicenta aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor. Este cantón es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, por la variedad de su fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora que en su mayoría se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Lucia, ella tiene 47 de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 14 y 8 años de edad que estudian en colegio y escuela. Ella tiene su casa propia en la que vive con sus hijos.

Trabaja de empleada pública en el cuerpo de bomberos 24 de mayo y además se desenvuelve como comerciante, vende ropa, principalmente ropa interior, sobrecamas y toallas. Su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y a esto le ayudan su hija y sus hermanas. Trabaja cuatro  días por las noches y los fines de semana todo el día,  sus productos los deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Su mercadería compra en  Guayaquil. Nos cuenta que lleva diez años que se dedica a esta actividad y que le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar sabanas y ropa interior para estudiantes que están por iniciar las clases. Está en el Banco Comunal de diez años y le gusta por la ayuda y por la forma de trabajar de la institución. Sus sueños son tener un gran local y ser empresaria.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor” (Mother for a Better Future) meets every fifteen days in the May 24th Canton in the Manabí Province. This canton is known for its beautiful landscapes, its forests, and the variety of plant life. The people are friendly and hardworking. Most of them engage in agriculture and livestock breeding.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Lucia. She is 47 years old and a single mother of two children (ages 14 and 8) who are high school and elementary school students respectively. Lucia has her own home where she lives with her children.

Lucia is a public employee who works at the May 24th Fire Station and also has a retail business. She sells clothing (primarily undergarments), bedspreads, and towels. Lucia sells door-to-door and also has the help of her daughter and her sisters. She works in the evenings four days per week and all day on the weekends. Lucia offers her products on credit and collects payments every eight days. Her merchandise is acquired in Guayaquil. She says that she has been in business for ten years and has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy bedding and children’s undergarments since students are starting their classes. Lucia has been with the Communal Bank for ten years and enjoys the assistance and the organization’s method of working. Her dreams are to have a large store and become a businesswoman.

loans.use: To purchase undergarments and bed sheets.

loans.name: Esmeralda Yaneth

texts.es:
Esmeralda, es una joven de 19 años de edad, reside en Delicias de Concepción departamento de Morazán, está soltera y vive con su madre y hermana. Ella se dedica a vender tortillas, aprendió por su madre desde muy pequeña, pero tiene su propio negocio hace 2 años.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, que es su materia prima en la ejecución de su venta, esta compra será una gran ayuda, pues el maíz es el principal para que ella pueda preparar las tortillas y disponerse a vender.
Su aspiración es estabilizar sus ingresos, para algún día casarse y formar su propio hogar con casa propia.
texts.en:
Esmeralda, 19, lives in Delicias de Concepción, Morazán Department.  She’s single living with her mother and her sister.  She sells tortillas.  She learned from her mother when she was very little but she’s had her own business for the last two years.

She is asking for a loan to buy corn since it’s the raw material for her sales.  This purchase will be of great help to her because corn is the main thing she needs to make the tortillas she intends to sell.  Her hope is to stabilize her income so that she can marry someday and form her own home in a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is a 39-year-old widow who has two children who are 14 and two years old. Her oldest child completed high school but was not financially able to go on to college. Vestine makes a living by selling bananas and a beverage that is popular locally which is called Ubushera. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and has made enough money to feed her family. She is applying for a loan to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy bananas and a beverage made out of sorghum called Ubushera.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda P. is from the village of Anakan, Gingoog City. She is 60 years old. Melinda is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Melinda owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling firewood in the local community. Melinda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Melinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melinda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stocks of firewood. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Melinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of firewood.

loans.name: Sop Mohamed Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Mohamed est créé depuis le 28 mars 2008, il fait partie du Banc Villageois Artillerie 2; il est composé de 15 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce. 

La responsable Khady est âgée de 34 ans, elle est mariée et a 5 enfants en charge.Elle est à l'extrême droite sur la photo en boubou couleur orange rouge avec un châle blanc sur les épaules. Elle mène une activité de petit commerce de fruits selon la période (oranges, mangues, melons etc......)elle fait parallèlement de l'aviculture.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter des poussins et des fruits pour renforcer ses activités.

Elle son mari dans les dépenses familiales et la santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The Sop Mohamed solidarity group was created on March 28, 2008; it belongs to the Artillerie 2 'Banc Villageois' (loan group). It is composed of 15 women who live in the same neighborhood. Their main activity is retail.

Khady, the leader, is 34 years old. She is married and has five dependent children. She is all the way to the right on the picture, in a red-orange bubu with a white shawl on her shoulders. She manages a small business retailing seasonal fruits (oranges, mangoes, melons, etc......). In parallel, she raises poultry.

Her new loan will allow her to purchase chicks and fruits to strengthen her activities.

She helps her husband with family expenses and children's healthcare.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal fruits for retail.

loans.name: Las Estrellitas De Carabayllo Group

texts.es: La señora Meri Carmen F., integra el Grupo "Las Estrellitas D. Carabayllo",  Meri Carmen, tiene 27 años D. edad es soltera y tiene un hijo desD. joven siempre le ha gustado trabajar para ayudar a su familia, actualmente se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza (cosmeticos).  Inicio en este negocio por intermedio D. una vecina que le vendia a ella y la animo para que pueda vender. Su deseo adorado como toda madre es poder ver a su hijo profesional pero a la vez ella desea poder tener una zapateria en donD. pueda vender diversidad D. calzados.  El prestamo lo invirtio para la compra D. productos D. belleza y stockearse ya que viene campaña por el dia del padre.
texts.en: Meri is 27 years old, single, and has one son. She's enjoyed working from a young age to help her family. At the moment, she works selling beauty products. She got into the business through a neighbor, who sold to her and encouraged her to begin selling. Like every mother, her fondest wish is to see her son grow up to be successful, but she'd also like to have a shoe store where she could sell all kinds of shoes. She is using this loan to purchase beauty products and restock, since she'll be selling more for Father's Day.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Ramir

texts.en:
Ramir is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Ramir provides motorela or habal-habal (transportation) services. He has had this business for eight years. He has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the utilities needed for the maintenance of the service.

Ramir has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Ramir hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the utilities needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle service.

loans.name: Takalani Group

texts.en:
Tholakele is 47 years old and single with four children between 2 and 17 years old. Three of the children attend school.  Her other source of income is the government’s child support grant. In the photo above, she is standing in the middle of her group with her hand raised.

She’s been in this business for three years and sells skirts, shirts, shoes, trousers, and underwear in Hlabisa, South Africa. She requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to sell more clothing from her home and at pension pay points. 

The main challenge to her business is that customers buy on credit and fail to pay on time. In five years time, she would like to have a formal place for her business. The extra income from this loan will help her extend her house and send her children to school.

She appreciates WDB and KIVA and hopes that they will help others as well.

loans.use: to buy skirts, shirts, shoes, trousers and underwear

loans.name: Sa Em

texts.en:
Sa em (in the photo) and her husband, Khoeun, live in a village along National Road Number four, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three sons and one daughter-two are in school and other two are still young. 

Sa em is a garment worker, while her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for another loan of $1,200 to fill-up the land around her house. Because the house where she lives is low than her neighboring houses, so when raining season come the water flooded which is difficult for family members to stay.

loans.use: To fill up the land around her house with more soil

loans.name: Maria Florence

texts.en:
Maria Florence is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Maria Florence has a retail shop that sells beauty & clothing products from AVON. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional stocks from AVON & NATASHA.

Maria Florence is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Maria Florence hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional  stock from AVON & NATASHA.

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and has three children. 

Adel has been an owner of an automotive workshop since 2004. He fixes and repairs all cars’ electrical problems.  He has good experience in this field and a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2,200 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his workshop and to purchase a generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his workshop and to purchase a generator.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah  lives in  Uganda.  She is single and has 2 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (mother).
   
Sarah has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 5 years and she works 6 days out of every week.  Sarah sells her products from home, by means of retail.  Sarah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.     

She also generates additional income through selling piped water.  The main business challenges for Sarah include increased prices of charcoal and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to be a wholesaler and to build and own her own house.  Sarah lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Johanna Del Carmen

texts.es: Este cliente es originario de la comarca las mercedes jurisdicción de Quezalguaque, actualmente se desempeña como maestra de secundaria en el Instituto Rubén Darío de la misma localidad, atendiendo 2 turnos diurno y dominical, su núcleo familiar se compone por 4 persona ella, su esposo y  2 hijos, los que estudian en los colegios de la misma localidad, esta señora ha sido cliente de la empresa desde el año 2008, actualmente está solicitando es crédito numero 3 este ultimo atraves del convenio firmado de financiamiento con dicho instituto, ya que los mismos le han ayudado a mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
This customer is originally from the Las Mercedes area of Quezalguaque. She is currently a high school teacher at Instituto Rubén Darío in the same town, working two shifts: daily and Sundays. Her family is made up of four people: herself, her husband and two children who go to school in the same town.

This lady has been a customer of the company since 2008. Now she is asking for loan number three through the financing agreement she signed with the institute since these loans have helped her improve her living conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: to improve an annex by buying blocks, cement, sand and paying for labor.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
This is Marivic, 32, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Ramil, a graphic artist, and is mother to her only child. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Marivic operates an LPG business. What she basically does is buy liquefied petroleum gas tanks from wholesalers and sells them per tank with a little profit. LPG tanks can range from small to regular size tanks. Aside from this, she also retails electronic cellphone loads (prepaid cellphone credits) and offers direct selling products. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 41,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stock of LPG tanks to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Marivic dreams of having other branches someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies there.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of products needed in her business

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
A caring lady, Rani manages her household chores by staying at home. She takes care of her family by cooking good food. Her husband gifted her a sewing machine, which she uses to sew clothes for her neighboring clients. She operates it when she gets free from her household work. She loves to do good for her family.   

Rani has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who has a furniture polisher business.  With the loan, he will buy polish and brushes to provide better quality services to his customers and increase his profits.  He is an experienced businessman and has been operating his business for many years. Rani is confident that an investment will take his business to a more profitable position. 

This is Rani's 2nd loan application to Asasah. In her previous loan year, she paid installments regularly without any problem. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rani.

loans.use: to buy polish and brushes

loans.name: Aly

texts.en:
Aly is 42 years old and has been engaged in a hog-fattening business for 18 years. Within these years of operating this occupation, she often experiences a lack of the feeds that are fed to her pigs. This causes her to ask for a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy feeds and vitamins. She wants her pigs to be healthy and nourished in order to sell them for a higher price.

She is aiming to save enough money for the educational purposes of her four children. She trained well in this occupation and yet, she feels difficulty, especially when she lacks money to finance the needs of her pigs. Thus, borrowing working capital is a big contribution to her as a hardworking woman.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Helen Maria

texts.es:
Hellen es una mujer luchadora, tiene 45 años y vive con su familia, en una comunidad del distrito de Hatillo que es una zona urbana y residencial, sin embargo es objeto de una creciente actividad comercial, concentrada principalmente en los centros comerciales. Se ha ubicado gran cantidad de mueblerías, tortillerías, panaderías, librerías, talleres mecánicos y automotrices, gasolineras, dentisterías, farmacias, consultorios médicos, bares, restaurantes, tiendas e imprentas.

En este momento está pasando por una situación económica difícil, ya que es madre soltera. Y las entradas de dinero que tiene, no son suficientes para financiar la carrera de su hija.

Es por eso que Hellen está solicitando un crédito de 450,000.00 (cuatrocientos cincuenta mil colones), para cancelar el pago del cuatrimestre  de la carrera universitaria de su hija y finalizar el pago de una computadora. Ya que tienen sus expectativas familiares en ella para asi tener un futuro  y una vida mejor.

Hellen es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Hatillo, una de las 110 empresas de crédito comunal de EDESA en Costa Rica. Es su segundo préstamo con la Empresa y da muchas gracias por toda ayuda que le han brindado.
texts.en:
Helen is a determined woman. She is 45 years old and lives with her family in a community in the District of Hatillo, which is a urban and residential area. However, there is increasing commercial activity that is mainly concentrated in the business centers. Several types of businesses are located in those areas such as furniture shops, tortilla factories, bakeries, bookstores, auto repair and mechanic shops, gas stations, dental offices, pharmacies, health clinics, bars, restaurants, stores, and print shops.

At the moment, Helen is going through a difficult financial situation since she is a single mother. With the limited access to income that she has, there is not enough money to finance her daughter’s degree.

For this reason, Helen is requesting a loan of 450,000 CRC so that she can pay for a semester of her daughter’s university degree and to finalize the payment of a computer. There are expectations being placed on her daughter by family members so that she can have a future and a better life.

Helen is a member of the Communal Credit Enterprise of Hatillo, one of the 110 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This is her second loan with the organization and she is grateful for all of the help that has been provided.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university expenses and to buy a computer.

loans.name: Kamket S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Kamket S.H.G Group in Western Kenya! Joseph is the facilitator of Kamket S.H.G group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Joseph takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season,Joseph had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,Joseph was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joseph and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Joseph will educate his children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Kamket S.H.G group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Bertha Camila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TETE CACA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bertha Camila; ella tiene 62 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de refrigerios como sandwichs, hamburguesas, gaseosas y galletas, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de refrigerios.
